A Sickening Lurch.Units.A Strangled Whis.value: This ship can transport any number of infantry and fighters, and they do not count against this ship's capacity.

A Sickening Lurch.Units.Bone Picked Clea.value: When you splice, capture 1 infantry from the reinforcements of any player with adjacent units; you can spend 1 captured infantry after rolling during combat to reroll this unit's dice.

Action Cards.Ancient Burial Sites.Descri.value: At the start of the agenda phase:
Choose 1 player. Exhause each cultural planet owned by that player.

Action Cards.Archaeological Expedition.D.value: ACTION: Reveal the top 3 cards of an exploration deck that matches a planet you control; gain any relic fragments that you reveal and discard the rest.

Action Cards.Assassinate Representative..value: Choose 1 player. That player cannot vote on this agenda.

Action Cards.Atomize.Description.value: Purge your flagship and destroy all other units in its system.

Action Cards.Black Market Dealings.Descr.value: When you are negotiating a transaction:
You and the other player can include relics, action cards, and unscored secret objectives as part of the transaction. This card cannot be cancelled.

Action Cards.Blitz.Description.value: At the start of an invasion:
Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that does not have BOMBARDMENT gains BOMBARDMENT 6 until the end of the invasion.

Action Cards.Bribery.Description.value: After the speaker votes on an agenda:
Spend any number of trade goods. For each trade good spent, cast 1 additional vote for the outcome on which you voted.

Action Cards.Brilliance.Description.value: ACTION: Ready 1 of your planets that has a technology speciality or choose 1 player to gain their breakthrough.

Action Cards.Bunker.Description.value: At the start of an invasion:
During this invasion, apply -4 to the result of each BOMBARDMENT roll against planets you control.

Action Cards.Cloak.Description.value: Your ships can move through systems that contain other players' ships during this action, and SPACE CANNON cannot be used against them.

Action Cards.Coerce.Description.value: ACTION: Choose a player. That player must give you 1 of their abilities.

Action Cards.Command.Description.value: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action. Additionally, your ships may move through and into asteroid fields during this movement.

Action Cards.Confounding Legal Text.Desc.value: When another player is elected as the outcome of an agenda:
You are the elected player instead.

Action Cards.Confusing Legal Text.Descri.value: When you are elected as the outcome of an agenda:
Choose 1 player. That player is the elected player instead.

Action Cards.Construction Rider.Descript.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 space dock from your reinforcements on a planet you control.

Action Cards.Converge.Description.value: Before you roll dice for SPACE CANNON:
Your hits must be applied to non-fighter ships during SPACE CANNON OFFENSE, or mechs during SPACE CANNON DEFENSE, if able.

Action Cards.Counterstroke.Description.value: After another player activates a system that contains 1 of your command tokens:
Return that command token to your tactic pool.

Action Cards.Coup d'Etat.Description.value: When another player would perform a strategic action:
End that player's trun; that strategic action is not resolved and the strategy card is not exhausted.

Action Cards.Courageous to the End.Descr.value: After 1 of your ships is destroyed during a space combat:
Roll 2 dice. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, your opponent must choose and destroy 1 of their ships.

Action Cards.Crash Landing.Description.value: When your last ship in the active system is destroyed:

Place 1 of your ground forces from the space area of the active system onto a planet in that system other than Mecatol Rex; if the planet contains other players' units, place your ground force into coexistence.

Action Cards.Cripple Defenses.Descriptio.value: ACTION: Choose 1 planet. Destroy each PDS on that planet.

Action Cards.Crisis.Description.value: At the end of any player's turn, if there are at least 2 players who have not passed:

Action Cards.Deadly Plot.Description.value: During the agenda phase, when an outcome would be resolved:
If you voted for or predicted another outcome, discard the agenda instead; the agenda is resolved with no effect and it is not replaced.
Then, exhaust all of your planets.

Action Cards.Decoy Operation.Description.value: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your structures:
Remove up to 2 of your ground forces from the game board and place them on a planet you control in the active system.

Action Cards.Diplomacy Rider.Description.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, choose 1 system that contains a planet you control. Each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in that system.

Action Cards.Diplomatic Pressure.Descrip.value: Choose another player; that player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.

Action Cards.Direct Hit.Description.value: After another player's ship uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities:

Action Cards.Disable.Description.value: At the start of an invasion in a system that contains 1 or more of your opponents' PDS units:
Your opponents' PDS units lose PLANETARY SHIELD and SPACE CANNON during this invasion.

Action Cards.Distinguished Councilor.Des.value: After you cast votes on an outcome of an agenda:
Cast 5 additional votes for that outcome.

Action Cards.Divert Funding.Description.value: ACTION: Return a non-unit upgrade, non-faction technology that you own to your technology deck.

Action Cards.Divinity.Description.value: When 1 of your units would be destroyed:

Action Cards.Economic Initiative.Descrip.value: ACTION: Ready each cultural planet you control.

Action Cards.Emergency Repairs.Descripti.value: At the start or end of a combat round:
Repair all of your units that have SUSTAIN DAMAGE in the active system.

Action Cards.Engineer.Description.value: When you draw cards for a splice that you initiated:
Add 2 additional cards to the splice; after you choose your card, choose and discard 2 of the spliced cards before passing them to the next player.

Action Cards.Entangle.Description.value: All systems that contain alpha wormholes, beta wormholes, gamma wormholes, and gravity rifts are adjacent during this movement.

Action Cards.Evolve.Description.value: ACTION: Draw 1 card from any splice deck.

Action Cards.Exchange Program.Descriptio.value: ACTION: Choose another player. You and the planet may agree to place 1 infantry from each of your reinforcements into coexistence on a planet the other player controls that contains their ground forces; if no agreement is reached, you each discard 1 token from your fleet pool.

Action Cards.Experimental Battlestation..value: After another player moves ships into a system during a tactical action:
Choose 1 of your space docks that is either in or adjacent to that system. That space dock uses SPACE CANNON 5 (x3) against ships in the active system.

Action Cards.Exploration Probe.Descripti.value: ACTION: Explore a frontier token that is in or adjacent to a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

Action Cards.Extreme Duress.Description.value: At the start of another player's turn, if they have a readied strategy card:
If that player's next action is not a strategic action, they discard all of their action cards, give you all of their trade goods, and show you all of their secret objectives.

Action Cards.Feint.Description.value: Your units immediately retreat to an eligible system; do not place a command token in that system.

Action Cards.Fighter Conscription.Descri.value: ACTION: Place 1 fighter from your reinforcements into each system that contains 1 or more of your space docks or ships that have a capacity value; they cannot be placed in systems that contain other players' ships.

Action Cards.Fighter Prototype.Descripti.value: At the start of the first round of a space combat:
Apply +2 to the result of each of your fighters' combat rolls during this combat round.

Action Cards.Fire Team.Description.value: After your ground forces make combat rolls during a round of ground combat:
Reroll any number of your dice.

Action Cards.Flank Speed.Description.value: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.

Action Cards.Flux.Description.value: ACTION: Either remove any player's command token from the board, or place a command token from any player's reinforcements in a system that contains or is adjacent to one of your ships.

Action Cards.Focused Research.Descriptio.value: ACTION: Spend 4 trade goods to research 1 technology.

Action Cards.Forward Supply Base.Descrip.value: After another player activates a system that contains your units:
Gain 3 trade goods. Then, choose another player to gain 1 trade good.

Action Cards.Frontline Deployment.Descri.value: ACTION: Place 3 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

Action Cards.Genophage.Description.value: ACTION: Discard 1 of your neighbors' genomes.

Action Cards.Ghost Ship.Description.value: ACTION: Place 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a non-home system that contains a wormhole and does not contain other players' ships.

Action Cards.Ghost Squad.Description.value: After a player commits units to land on a planet you control:
Move any number of ground forces from any planet you control in the active system to any other planet you control in the active system.

Action Cards.Hack Election.Description.value: During this agenda, voting begins with the player to the right of the speaker and continues counterclockwise.

Action Cards.Hack Election.TE.Descriptio.value: During this agenda, you vote last.

Action Cards.Hardlight.Description.value: Before hits are assigned to your units:

Action Cards.Helix.Description.value: ACTION: Initiate a splice of any type, including all players.

Action Cards.Ignis.Description.value: ACTION: Place a command token from your tactic pool in any non-home system; choose and destroy 1 unit in that system.

Action Cards.Imperial Rider.Description.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 victory point.

Action Cards.Impersonation.Description.value: ACTION: Spend 3 influence to draw 1 secret objective.

Action Cards.In The Silence Of Space.Des.value: Choose 1 system. During this tactical action, your ships in the chosen system can move through systems that contain other players' ships.

Action Cards.Industrial Initiative.Descr.value: ACTION: Gain 1 trade good for each industrial planet you control.

Action Cards.Infiltrate.Description.value: When you gain control of a planet:
Replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

Action Cards.Insider Information.Descrip.value: Look at the top card of the agenda deck.

Action Cards.Insider Information.TE.Desc.value: Look at the top 3 cards of the agenda deck.

Action Cards.Insubordination.Description.value: ACTION: Remove 1 token from another player's tactic pool and return it to their reinforcements.

Action Cards.Intercept.Description.value: After your opponent declares a retreat during a space combat:
Your opponent cannot retreat during this round of space combat.

Action Cards.Irradiate.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 unit type other than flagship; reveal cards from the unit upgrade deck until you reveal a card of that type, if able. Then, gain that card and shuffle the rest back into the unit upgrade deck.

Action Cards.Lash.Description.value: When 1 of your units is destroyed:
Destroy a unit in its system that has an equal or lower cost.

Action Cards.Leadership Rider.Descriptio.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 3 command tokens.

Action Cards.Lie in Wait.Description.value: After 2 of your neighbors resolve a transaction:
Look at each of those players' hands of action cards, then choose and take 1 action card from each.

Action Cards.Locust.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 infantry in a system adjacent to your units and roll 1 die. On a result of 3 or higher, destroy that infantry and choose an infantry in the same or an adjacent system to repeat this roll; for each new roll, choose an infantry owned by a different player than the previous infantry, if able.

Action Cards.Lost Star Chart.Description.value: During this tactical action, systems that contain alpha and beta wormholes are adjacent to each other.

Action Cards.Lucky Shot.Description.value: ACTION: Destroy 1 dreadnought, cruiser, or destroyer in a system that contains a planet you control.

Action Cards.Magnificence.Description.value: ACTION: Move all units from the space area of any system into an adjacent system that contains a different player's ships. Space combat is resolved in that system; neither player can retreat or resolve abilities that would move their ships.

Action Cards.Maneuvering Jets.Descriptio.value: Before you assign hits produced by another player's SPACE CANNON roll:

Action Cards.Manifest.Description.value: ACTION: Resolve the PRODUCTION ability of 1 of your units; reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 3.

Action Cards.Manipulate Investments.Desc.value: At the start of the strategy phase:
Place a total of 5 trade goods from the supply on strategy cards of your choice; you must place these tokens on at least 3 different cards.

Action Cards.Manipulate.Description.value: After cards are drawn for a splice that you are not participating in:
Take the cards and choose which card each participating player will take.

Action Cards.Meddle.Description.value: Add or subtract 1 from its result.

Action Cards.Meld.Description.value: When a die is rolled by any player:
Roll two dice instead, and add the results together (max 10).

Action Cards.Mercenary Contract.Descript.value: ACTION: Spend 2 trade goods to place 2 neutral infantry on any non-home planet that contains no units; if that planet was owned by another player, they return its planet card to the planet card deck.

Action Cards.Meteor.Description.value: When you would remove ground forces due to insufficient capacity:
Commit those ground forces to a planet in that system instead; resolve an invasion on that planet using only those ground forces.

Action Cards.Mining Initiative.Descripti.value: ACTION: Gain trade goods equal to the resource value of 1 planet you control.

Action Cards.Morale Boost.Description.value: At the start of a combat round:
Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.

Action Cards.Mutate.Description.value: ACTION: Discard 1 of your abilities, then draw 1 ability.

Action Cards.Nav Suite.Description.value: During the "Movement" step of this tactical action, ignore the effect of anomalies.

Action Cards.Overrule.Description.value: ACTION: Perform the primary ability of a readied or unchosen strategy card.

Action Cards.Parley.Description.value: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control:
Return the committed units to the space area.

Action Cards.Pax.Description.value: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control:
Return the committed units to the space area; choose 1 of them to destroy.

Action Cards.Pirate Contract.Description.value: ACTION: Place 1 neutral destroyer in a non-home system that contains no non-neutral ships.

Action Cards.Pirate Fleet.Description.value: ACTION: Spend 3 resources to place 1 neutral carrier, 1 neutral cruiser, 1 neutral destroyer, and 2 neutral fighters in a non-home system that contains no non-neutral ships.

Action Cards.Plagiarize.Description.value: ACTION: Spend 5 influence and choose a non-faction technology owned by one of your neighbors; gain that technology.

Action Cards.Plague.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 planet that is controlled by another player. Roll 1 die for each infantry on that planet. For each result of 6 or greater, destroy 1 of those units.

Action Cards.Political Stability.Descrip.value: When you would return your strategy card(s) during the status phase:
Do not return your strategy card(s). You do not choose strategy cards during the next strategy phase.

Action Cards.Politics Rider.Description.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 3 action cards and gain the speaker token.

Action Cards.Public Disgrace.Description.value: When another player chooses a strategy card during the strategy phase:
That player must choose a different strategy card instead, if able.

Action Cards.Puppets on a String.Descrip.value: At the end of any player's turn, if you have passed:

Action Cards.Rally.Description.value: After you activate a system that contains another player's ships:
Place 2 command tokens from your reinforcements in your fleet pool.

Action Cards.Reactor Meltdown.Descriptio.value: ACTION: Destroy 1 space dock in a non-home system.

Action Cards.Refit Troops.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 or 2 of your infantry on the game board; replace each of those infantry with mechs.

Action Cards.Reflect.Description.value: ACTION: For each trade good you have, either gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

Action Cards.Reflective Shielding.Descri.value: When one of your ships uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE during combat:
Produce 2 hits against your opponent's ships in the active system.

Action Cards.Reparations.Description.value: After another player gains control of a planet you control:
Exhaust 1 planet that player controls and ready 1 planet you control.

Action Cards.Rescue.Description.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains your ships:
You may move 1 of your ships into the active system from any system that does not contain one of your command tokens.

Action Cards.Reveal Prototype.Descriptio.value: At the start of a combat:
Spend 4 resources to research a unit upgrade technology of the same type as 1 of your units that is participating in this combat.

Action Cards.Reverse Engineer.Descriptio.value: After another player discards an action card that has a component action:
Take that action card from the discard pile.

Action Cards.Reverse.Description.value: Reverse the order the spliced cards are passed.

Action Cards.Rise of a Messiah.Descripti.value: ACTION: Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on each planet you control.

Action Cards.Rise.Description.value: ACTION: Either place 1 infantry on each planet you control or place 1 fighter in each system that contains your ships or space docks and no other players' ships.

Action Cards.Rout.Description.value: At the start of the "Announce Retreats" step of space combat, if you are the defender:
Your opponent must announce a retreat, if able.

Action Cards.Sabotage.Description.value: When another player plays an action card other than "Sabotage":

Action Cards.Salvage.Description.value: After you win a space combat:
Your opponent gives you all of their commodities.

Action Cards.Sanction.Description.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player that voted for that outcome returns 1 command token from their fleet supply to their reinforcements.

Action Cards.Scarab.Description.value: ACTION: Choose a spliced card you own; gain 2 trade goods for each card you own with a faction origin that matches that card.

Action Cards.Scramble Frequency.Descript.value: After another player makes a BOMBARDMENT, SPACE CANNON, or ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE roll:
That player rerolls all of their dice.

Action Cards.Scuttle.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 or 2 of your non-fighter ships on the game board and return them to your reinforcements; gain trade goods equal to the combined cost of those ships.

Action Cards.Seize Artifact.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 of your neighbors that has 1 or more relic fragments. That player must give you 1 relic fragment of your choice.

Action Cards.Shatter.Description.value: When another player exhausts a genome or plays an action card other than "Shatter":
That genome is exhausted without effect, or that action card is canceled.

Action Cards.Shields Holding.Description.value: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat:

Action Cards.Signal Jamming.Description.value: ACTION: Chose 1 non-home system that contains or is adjacent to 1 of your ships. Place a command token from another player's reinforcements in that system.

Action Cards.Skilled Retreat.Description.value: At the start of a combat round:

Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; the space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.

Action Cards.Solar Flare.Description.value: During the "Movement" step of this tactical action, other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships.

Action Cards.Spark.Description.value: After another player's unit uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities:

Action Cards.Spy.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 player. That player gives you 1 random action card from their hand.

Action Cards.Starflare.Description.value: ACTION: Choose a supernova; each player destroys 3 of their units in that supernova and each adjacent system.

Action Cards.Stasis.Description.value: At the start of another player's turn:

Action Cards.Strategize.Description.value: ACTION: Perform the secondary ability of any readied or unchosen strategy card.

Action Cards.Summit.Description.value: At the start of the strategy phase:

Action Cards.Tactical Bombardment.Descri.value: ACTION: Choose 1 system that contains 1 or more of your units that have BOMBARDMENT. Exhaust each planet controlled by other players in that system.

Action Cards.Tartarus.Description.value: At the start of the strategy phase:
Choose a strategy card; that card cannot be picked unless there is no other option.

Action Cards.Technology Rider.Descriptio.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, research 1 technology.

Action Cards.Thieve.Description.value: When a splice ends, if you did not participate:
Take all of the remaining spliced cards.

Action Cards.Timestop.Description.value: When a player activates a system that contains your units:
Immediately perform an action, during which you are the active player.

Action Cards.Trade Rider.Description.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 5 trade goods.

Action Cards.Transpose.Description.value: ACTION: Give 1 of your abilities to one of your neighbors, then take 1 of their abilities.

Action Cards.Trine.Description.value: During the "Space Cannon Offense" step of a tactical action:
Your units up to 2 systems away can use their SPACE CANNON abilities against ships in the active system.

Action Cards.Twinning.Description.value: After another player resolves the component action of an action card:
Immediately resolve that action card as if you played it.

Action Cards.Unexpected Action.Descripti.value: ACTION: Remove 1 of your command tokens from the game board and return it to your reinforcements.

Action Cards.Unravel.Description.value: ACTION: Choose and purge a relic. If the relic belonged to another player, that player gains 1 victory point; if it belonged to you, put The Fracture into play and place 1 additional ingress token in a system that contains your units.

Action Cards.Unstable Planet.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 hazardous planet. Exhaust that planet and destroy up to 3 infantry on it.

Action Cards.Upgrade.Description.value: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:
Replace one of your cruisers in that system with one of your dreadnoughts from your reinforcements.

Action Cards.Uprising.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust 1 non-home planet controlled by another player. Then gain trade goods equal to its resource value.

Action Cards.Vault.Description.value: You may ignore the effects of anomalies during this movement.

Action Cards.Veto.Description.value: Discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

Action Cards.War Effort.Description.value: ACTION: Place 1 cruiser from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

Action Cards.War Machine.Description.value: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION:
Apply +4 to the total PRODUCTION value of those units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.

Action Cards.Warfare Rider.Description.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 dreadnought from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

Action Cards.Waylay.Description.value: Before you roll dice for ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE:
Hits from this roll are produced against all ships (not just fighters).

Agendas.Anti-Intellectual Revolution.Des.value: For: After a player researches a technology, they must destroy 1 of their non-fighter ships.
Against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player chooses and exhausts 1 planet for each technology they own.

Agendas.Armed Forces Standardization.Des.value: The elected player places command tokens from their reinforcements so that they have 3 tokens in their tactic pool, 3 tokens in their fleet pool and 2 tokens in their strategy pool. They return any excess tokens to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Arms Reduction.Description.value: For: Each player destroys all but 2 of their dreadnaughts and all but 4 of their cruisers.
Against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts each of their planets that have a technology specialty.

Agendas.Articles of War.Description.value: FOR : All mechs lose their printed abilities except for SUSTAIN DAMAGE.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "For" gains 3 trade goods.

Agendas.Checks and Balances.Description.value: FOR : When a player chooses a strategy card during the strategy phase, they give that strategy card to another player that does not have 1 (or a player that does not have 2 in a three- or four-player game), if able.
AGAINST : Each player readies only 3 of their planets at the end of this agenda phase.

Agendas.Clandestine Operations.Descripti.value: For: Each player removes 2 command tokens from their command sheet and returns those tokens to their reinforcements.
Against: Each player removes 1 command token from their fleet pool and returns that token to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Classified Document Leaks.Descri.value: When this agenda is revealed, if there are no scored secret objectives, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
The elected secret objective becomes a public objective; place it near the other public objectives in the common play area.

Agendas.Colonial Redistribution.Descript.value: Destroy each unit on the elected planet.
Then, the player who controls that planet chooses 1 player with the fewest victory points; that player may place 1 infantry from their reinforcements on the elected planet.

Agendas.Committee Formation.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
Before players vote on an agenda that requires a player to be elected, the owner of this card may discard this card to choose a player to be elected. Players do not vote on that agenda.

Agendas.Compensated Disarmament.Descript.value: Destroy each ground force on the elected planet; for each unit that was destroyed, the player who controls that planet gains 1 trade good.

Agendas.Conventions of War.Description.value: For: Players cannot use BOMBARDMENT against units that are on cultural planets.
Against: Each player that voted "Against" discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Core Mining.Description.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
Then, destroy 1 infantry on the planet.
The resource value of this planet is increased by 2.

Agendas.Covert Legislation.Description.value: When this agenda is revealed, the speaker draws the next card in the agenda deck but does not reveal it to the other players.

Instead, the speaker reads the eligible outcomes aloud (For, Against, Elect Player, etc.); the other players vote for these outcomes as if they were outcomes of this agenda, without knowing their effects.

Agendas.Demilitarized Zone.Description.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
Then, destroy all units on that planet.
Player's units cannot land, be produced, or be placed on this planet.

Agendas.Economic Equality.Description.value: For: Each player returns all of their trade goods to the supply. Then, each player gains 5 trade goods.
Against: Each player returns all of their trade goods to the supply.

Agendas.Enforced Travel Ban.Description.value: For: Alpha and beta wormholes have no effect during movement.
Against: Destroy each PDS in or adjacent to a system that contains a wormhole.

Agendas.Executive Sanctions.Description.value: For: Each player can have a maximum of 3 action cards in their hand.
Against: Each player discards 1 random action card from their hand.

Agendas.Fleet Regulations.Description.value: For: Each player cannot have more than 4 tokens in their fleet pool.
Against: Each player places 1 command token from their reinforcements in their fleet pool.

Agendas.Galactic Crisis Pact.Description.value: Each player may perform the secondary ability of the elected strategy card without spending a command token; command tokens placed by the ability are placed from a player's reinforcements instead.

Agendas.Holy Planet of Ixth.Description.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The planet's owner gains 1 victory point.
Units on this planet cannot use PRODUCTION.
When a player gains control of this planet, they gain 1 victory point.
When a player loses control of this planet, they lose 1 victory point.

Agendas.Homeland Defense Act.Description.value: For: Each player can have any number of PDS units on planets they control.
Against: Each player destroys 1 of their PDS units.

Agendas.Imperial Arbiter.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
At the end of the strategy phase, the owner of this card may discard this card to swap 1 of their strategy cards with 1 of another player's strategy cards.

Agendas.Incentive Program.Description.value: For: Draw and reveal 1 stage I public objective from the deck and place it near the public objectives.
Against: Draw and reveal 1 stage II public objective from the deck and place it near the public objectives.

Agendas.Ixthian Artifact.Description.value: For: The speaker rolls 1 die. If the result is 6-10, each player may research 2 technologies. If the result is 1-5, destroy all units in Mecatol Rex's system, and each player with units in systems adjacent to Mecatol Rex's system destroys 3 of their units in each of those systems.

Agendas.Judicial Abolishment.Description.value: When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
Discard the elected law from play.

Agendas.Minister of Commerce.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
After the owner of this card replenishes commodities, they gain 1 trade good for each player that is their neighbor.

Agendas.Minister of Exploration.Descript.value: The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card gains control of a planet, they gain 1 trade good.

Agendas.Minister of Industry.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card places a space dock in a system, their units in that system may use their PRODUCTION abilities.

Agendas.Minister of Peace.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
After a player activates a system that contains 1 or more of a different player's units, the owner of this card may discard this card; immediately end the active player's turn.

Agendas.Minister of Policy.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
At the end of the status phase, the owner of this card draws 1 action card.

Agendas.Minister of Sciences.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Technology" strategy card, they do not need to spend resources to research technology.

Agendas.Minister of War.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.

The owner of this card may discard this card after performing an action to remove 1 of their command counters from the game board and return it to their reinforcements; then they may perform 1 additional action.

Agendas.Miscount Disclosed.Description.value: When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
Vote on the elected law as if it were just revealed from the top of the deck.

Agendas.Mutiny.Description.value: For: Each player who voted "For" gains 1 victory point.
Against: Each player who voted "For" loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.New Constitution.Description.value: When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
For: Discard all laws in play. At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts each planet in their home system.

Agendas.Nexus Sovereignty.Description.value: FOR : Alpha and beta wormholes in the wormhole nexus have no effect during movement.
AGAINST : Place a gamma wormhole token in the Mecatol Rex system.

Agendas.Political Censure.Description.value: The elected player gains this card and 1 victory point.
The elected player cannot play action cards.
If the owner of this card loses this card, they lose 1 victory point.

Agendas.Prophecy of Ixth.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
The owner of this card applies +1 to the result of their fighter's combat rolls. When the owner of this card uses PRODUCTION, they discard this card unless they produce 2 or more fighters.

Agendas.Public Execution.Description.value: The elected player discards all of their action cards. If they have the speaker token, they give it to the player on their left. The elected player cannot vote on any agendas during this agenda phase.

Agendas.Publicize Weapon Schematics.Desc.value: For: If any player owns a war sun technology, all players may ignore all prerequisites on war sun technologies. All war suns lose SUSTAIN DAMAGE.
Against: Each player that owns a war sun technology discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Rearmament Agreement.Description.value: FOR : Each player places 1 mech from their reinforcements on a planet they control in their home system.
AGAINST : Each player replaces each of their mechs with 1 infantry from their reinforcements.

Agendas.Regulated Conscription.Descripti.value: For: When a player produces units, they produce only 1 fighter and infantry for its cost instead of 2.

Agendas.Representative Government.Descri.value: For: Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase. Each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead.
Against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted "Against" exhausts all of their cultural planets.

Agendas.Representative Government.Omega..value: For: Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase; each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead. Players cannot cast additional votes.
Against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted "Against" exhausts all of their cultural planets.

Agendas.Research Grant Reallocation.Desc.value: The elected player gains any 1 technology of their choice. Then, for each prerequisite on that technology, they remove 1 token from their fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Research Team: Biotic.Descriptio.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 green prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Cybernetic.Descri.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 yellow prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Propulsion.Descri.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 blue prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Warfare.Descripti.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 red prerequisite.

Agendas.Search Warrant.Description.value: The elected player gains this card and draws 2 secret objectives.
The owner of this card plays with their secret objectives revealed.

Agendas.Seed of an Empire.Description.value: For: The player with most victory points gains 1 victory point.
Against: The player with the fewest victory points gains 1 victory point.

Agendas.Senate Sanctuary.Description.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The influence value of this planet is increased by 2.

Agendas.Shard of the Throne.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
A player gains this card and 1 victory point when they win a combat against the owner of this card.
Then, the previous owner of this card loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.Shared Research.Description.value: For: Each player's units can move through nebulae.
Against: Each player places a command token from their reinforcements in their home system, if able.

Agendas.Swords to Plowshares.Description.value: For: Each player destroys half of their infantry on each planet they control, rounded up. Then, each player gains trade goods equal to the number of their infantry that were destroyed.
Against: Each player places 1 infantry from their reinforcements on each planet they control.

Agendas.Terraforming Initiative.Descript.value: Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The resource and influence values of this planet are increased by 1.

Agendas.The Crown of Emphidia.Descriptio.value: The elected player gains this card.
A player gains this card and 1 victory point after they gain control of a planet in the home system of this card's owner.
Then, the previous owner of this card loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.The Crown of Thalnos.Description.value: The elected player gains this card.
During each combat round, the owner of this card may reroll any number of dice; they must destroy each of their units that did not produce a hit with its reroll.

Agendas.Unconventional Measures.Descript.value: For: Each player that voted "For" draws 2 action cards.
Against: Each player that voted "For" discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Wormhole Reconstruction.Descript.value: For: All systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole are adjacent to each other.
Against: Each player places a command token from their reinforcements in each system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of their ships.

Agendas.Wormhole Research.Description.value: For: Each player who has 1 or more ships in a system that contains a wormhole may research 1 technology. Then, destroy all ships in systems that contain an alpha or beta wormhole.
Against: Each player that voted "Against" removes 1 command token from their command sheet and returns it to their reinforcements.

Arborec.Abilities.Mitosis.Description.value: Your space docks cannot produce infantry. At the start of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

Arborec.Breakthrough.Psychospore.Descrip.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to remove a command token from a system that contains 1 or more of your infantry and return it to your reinforcements.
Then, place 1 infantry in that system.

Arborec.Leaders.Dirzuga Rophal.Descripti.value: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your units that have PRODUCTION:
You may produce 1 unit in that system.

Arborec.Leaders.Dirzuga Rophal.Unlock.value: Have 12 ground forces on planets you control.

Arborec.Leaders.Letani Miasmiala.Descrip.value: ACTION: Produce any number of units in any number of systems that contain 1 or more of your ground forces.

Arborec.Leaders.Letani Ospha.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose a player's non-fighter ship; that player may replace that ship with one from their reinforcements that costs up to 2 more than the replaced ship

Arborec.Promissories.Stymie.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Arborec player cannot produce units in or adjacent to non-home systems that contain 1 or more of your units.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Arborec player's units, return this card to the Arborec player.

Arborec.Promissories.Stymie.Omega.Descri.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units:
You may place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system.
Then, return this card to the Arborec player.

Arborec.Techs.Bioplasmosis.Description.value: At the end of the status phase, you may remove any number of your infantry from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.

Arborec.Techs.Letani Warrior II.Descript.value: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 6 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Arborec.Units.Duha Menaimon.Description.value: After you activate this system, you may produce up to 5 units in this system.

Arborec.Units.Letani Behemoth.Descriptio.value: DEPLOY: When you would use your MITOSIS faction ability you may replace 1 of your infantry with 1 mech from your reinforcements instead.

Argent Flight.Abilities.Raid Formation.D.value: When 1 or more of your units uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, for each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has SUSTAIN DAMAGE to become damaged.

Argent Flight.Abilities.Zeal.Description.value: You always vote first during the agenda phase. When you cast at least 1 vote, cast 1 additional vote for each player in the game including you.

Argent Flight.Breakthrough.Wing Transfer.value: When you activate a system that contains only your units, you may place command tokens from your reinforcements into any systems adjacent to that system that contain only your units; at the end of this action, you may move ships among the active system and systems adjacent to it that contain your command tokens.

Argent Flight.Leaders.Mirik Aun Sissiri..value: ACTION: Move any number of your ships from any systems to any number of other systems that contain 1 of your command tokens and no other players' ships.

Argent Flight.Leaders.Trillossa Aun Miri.value: When a player produces ground forces in a system:
You may exhaust this card; that player may place those units on any planets they control in that system and any adjacent systems.

Argent Flight.Leaders.Trrakan Aun Zulok..value: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability:
You may choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.
Have 6 units that have ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, SPACE CANNON or BOMBARDMENT on the game board.

Argent Flight.Promissories.Strike Wing A.value: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability:
Choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die
Then, return this card to the Argent player

Argent Flight.Techs.Aerie Hololattice.De.value: Other players cannot move ships through systems that contain your structures.
Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the PRODUCTION 1 ability as if it were a unit.

Argent Flight.Techs.Strike Wing Alpha II.value: When this unit uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, each result of 9 or 10 also destroys 1 of your opponent's infantry in the space area of the active system.

Argent Flight.Units.Aerie Sentinel.Descr.value: This unit does not count against capacity if it is being transported or if it is in a space area with 1 or more of your ships that have capacity values.

Argent Flight.Units.Quetzecoatl.Descript.value: Other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships in this system.

Avarice Rex.Units.Delver.Description.value: When you splice, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

Avarice Rex.Units.Scintilla.Description.value: When you splice, gain 2 commodities or convert up to 2 of your commodities to trade goods.

BATnO1.value: Draw 3 Edicts and choose 1 to resolve.

Barony of Letnev.Abilities.Armada.Descri.value: The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool.

Barony of Letnev.Abilities.Munitions Res.value: At the start of each round of space combat, you may spend 2 trade goods; you may re-roll any number of your dice during that combat round.

Barony of Letnev.Breakthrough.Gravleash.value: Before you roll dice during space combat, apply +1 to the results of 1 of your ship's rolls, where X is the number of ship types you have in the combat.
During movement, your non-fighter ships' move values are equal to the highest move value amongst moving ships in the system they started in.

Barony of Letnev.Leaders.Darktalon Treil.value: ACTION: Place this card near the game board; the number of non-fighter ships you can have in systems is not limited by laws or by the number of command tokens in your fleet pool during this game round.
At the end of that game round, purge this card.

Barony of Letnev.Leaders.Rear Admiral Fa.value: After 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE:

Barony of Letnev.Leaders.Viscount Unlenn.value: At the start of a Space Combat round:
You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ship in the active system. That ship rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.

Barony of Letnev.Promissories.War Fundin.value: At the start of a round of space combat:
The Letnev player loses 2 trade goods.
During this combat round, re-roll any number of your dice.
Then, return this card to the Letnev player.
After you and your opponent roll dice during space combat:
You may reroll all of your opponent's dice.
You may reroll any number of your dice.
Then, return this card to the Letnev player.

Barony of Letnev.Techs.L4 Disruptors.Des.value: During an invasion, units cannot use SPACE CANNON against your units.

Barony of Letnev.Techs.Non-Euclidean Shi.value: When 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE, cancel 2 hits instead of 1.

Barony of Letnev.Units.Arc Secundus.Desc.value: Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD. At the start of each space combat round, repair this ship.

Barony of Letnev.Units.Dunlain Reaper.De.value: DEPLOY: At the start of a round of ground combat, you may spend 2 resources to replace 1 of your infantry in that combat with 1 mech.

Clan of Saar.Abilities.Nomadic.Descripti.value: You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.

Clan of Saar.Abilities.Scavenge.Descript.value: After you gain control of a planet, gain 1 trade good.

Clan of Saar.Breakthrough.Deorbit Barrag.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and spend any amount of resources to choose a planet up to 2 systems away from an asteroid field that contains your ships; roll a number of dice equal to the amount spent and assign 1 hit to a ground force on that planet for each roll of 4 or greater.

Clan of Saar.Leaders.Captain Mendosa.Des.value: After a player activates a system:
You may exhaust this card to increase the move value of 1 of that player's ships to match the move value of the ship on the game board that has the highest move value.

Clan of Saar.Leaders.Gurno Aggero.Descri.value: ACTION: Choose 1 system that is adjacent to 1 of your space docks. Destroy all other player's infantry and fighters in that system

Clan of Saar.Leaders.Rowl Sarrig.Descrip.value: When you produce fighters or infantry:
You may place each of those units at any of your space docks that are not blockaded.

Clan of Saar.Leaders.Rowl Sarrig.Unlock.value: Have 3 space docks on the game board.

Clan of Saar.Promissories.Ragh's Call.De.value: After you commit 1 or more units to land on a planet:
Remove all of the Saar player's ground forces from that planet and place them on a planet controlled by the Saar player.
Then return this card to the Saar player.

Clan of Saar.Techs.Chaos Mapping.Descrip.value: Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships.
At the start of your turn during the action phase, you may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units that has PRODUCTION.

Clan of Saar.Techs.Floating Factory II.D.value: This unit is placed in the space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

Clan of Saar.Units.Floating Factory I.De.value: This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

Clan of Saar.Units.Scavenger Zeta.Descri.value: DEPLOY: After you gain control of a planet, you may spend 1 trade good to place 1 mech on that planet.

Components.Age of Exploration.Descriptio.value: ACTION: Exhaust DARK ENERGY TAP and choose a non-home edge system that contains your ships to roll 1 die. On a result of 1-4, draw a random unused red tile; on a result of 5-10, draw a random unused blue tile. Place that tile adjacent to the chosen system so that it is touching at least 2 non-home systems. Place a frontier token in the system if it does not contain any planets.

Components.Black Market Forgery.Descript.value: ACTION: Purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic.
Then return this card to the Naaz-Rokha player.

Components.Blood Pact.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you and the Empyrean player cast votes for the same outcome, cast 4 additional votes for that outcome.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Components.Conventions of War Abandoned..value: ACTION: Exhaust X-89 BACTERIAL WEAPON to choose 1 planet in a system that contains 1 of your units that has BOMBARDMENT; purge its planet card and all attachments or legendary planet ability cards associated with it.

Components.Dark Pact.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you give a number of commodities to the Empyrean player equal to your maximum commodity value, you each gain 1 trade good.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Components.Enigmatic Device.Description.value: ACTION: You may spend 6 resources and purge this card to research 1 technology.

Components.Executive Order.Description.value: ACTION: Reveal the top or bottom card of the agenda deck and vote on it, being speaker. You may use trade goods to vote.

Components.Fabrication.Description.value: ACTION: Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic; or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

Components.Fires of the Gashlai.Descript.value: ACTION: Remove 1 token from the Muaat player's fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, gain your war sun unit upgrade technology card.
Then, return this card to the Muaat player.

Components.Gain Relic.Description.value: ACTION: Purge 3 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 Relic.

Components.Lazax Gate Folding.Descriptio.value: ACTION: If you control Mecatol Rex, exhaust this card to place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.

Components.Mageon Implants.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to look at another player's hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand.

Components.Mercenaries for Hire.Descript.value: ACTION: Spend 3 trade goods to gain the top card of the mercenary deck and place it in your play area.

Components.Nanomachines.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to place 1 PDS on a planet you control.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to repair all of your damaged units.
ACTION: Exhaust this card and discard 1 action card to draw 1 action card.

Components.Orbital Drop.Description.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

Components.Production Biomes.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to gain 4 trade goods and choose 1 other player; that player gains 2 trade goods.

Components.Promise of Protection.Descrip.value: ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Mentak player cannot use their PILLAGE faction ability against you.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Mentak player's units, return this card to the Mentak player.

Components.Puppets of the Blade.Descript.value: If you have at least 1 plot card in your play area, gain the following ability:
ACTION: Purge The Firmament's faction sheet, leaders, planet cards, and promissory note. Then, gain all of the faction components for The Obsidian.

Components.Sever.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area and place the sever token in a system that contains your units; wormholes in that system have no effect during movement.
Remove the sever token and return this card to the Rebellion player at the end of the status phase.

Components.Share Knowledge.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area and gain 1 non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology that the Deepwrought player owns; place this technology on this card.
Return that technology to the deck and this card to the Deepwrought player at the end of the status phase.

Components.Sling Relay.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to produce 1 ship in any system that contains one of your space docks.

Components.Stall Tactics.Description.value: ACTION: Discard 1 action card from your hand.

Components.Star Forge.Description.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your war suns.

Components.Stellar Atomics.Description.value: ACTION: Discard your control token from the Stellar Atomics card to destroy all ground forces and structures on any non-home planet.

Components.Stymie.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Arborec player cannot produce units in or adjacent to non-home systems that contain 1 or more of your units.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Arborec player's units, return this card to the Arborec player.

Components.Terraform.Description.value: ACTION: Attach this card to a non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex.
Its resource and influence values are each increased by 1 and it is treated as having all 3 planet traits (Cultural, Hazardous, and Industrial).

Components.The Inferno.Description.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 cruiser in this unit's system.

Components.Total War.Description.value: ACTION: Discard 10 commodities from planets in your home system to gain 1 victory point.

Components.Trade Convoys.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, you may negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Hacan player's units, return this card to the Hacan player.

Components.Vortex.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose another player's non-structure unit in a system that is adjacent to 1 or more of your space docks. Capture 1 unit of that type from that player's reinforcements.

Components.Wormhole Generator.Descriptio.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.

Components.X-89 Bacterial Weapon.Descrip.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose 1 planet in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships that have BOMBARDMENT; destroy all infantry on that planet.

Council Keleres.Abilities.Council Patron.value: Replenish your commodities at the start of the strategy phase, then gain 1 trade good.

Council Keleres.Abilities.Law's Order.De.value: You may spend 1 influence at the start of your turn to treat all laws as blank until the end of your turn.

Council Keleres.Abilities.Law's Order.Th.value: You may spend 1 trade good or 1 commodity at the start of any player's turn to treat all laws as blank until the end of that turn.

Council Keleres.Abilities.The Tribunii.D.value: During setup, choose an unplayed faction from among the Mentak, the Xxcha and the Argent Flight; take that faction's home system, command tokens and control markers. Additionally, take the Keleres Hero that corresponds to that faction.

Council Keleres.Abilities.The Tribunii.T.value: During setup, choose a Keleres hero that corresponds to an unused faction; take that faction's home system, command tokens and control tokens. The unchosen Keleres heroes are not used.

Council Keleres.Breakthrough.IIHQ Modern.value: When you gain this card, gain the Custodia Vigilia planet card and its legendary planet ability card.
You are neighbors with all players that have units or control planets in or adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Harka Leeds.Desc.value: ACTION: Reveal cards from the action card deck until you reveal 3 action cards that have component actions. Draw those cards and shuffle the rest back into the action card deck.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Kuuasi Aun Jalat.value: At the start of a round of space combat in a system that contains a planet you control:
Place your flagship and any combination of up to 2 cruisers or destroyers from your reinforcements into the active system.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Odlynn Myrr.Desc.value: You may cast up to 6 additional votes on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. For each player that abstains or votes for another outcome, gain 1 trade good and 1 command token.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Suffi An.Descrip.value: After you perform a component action:
You may perform an additional action.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Suffi An.Unlock.value: Spend 1 trade good after you play an action card that has a component action.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Xander Alexin Vi.value: You may exhaust this card to allow any player to spend commodities as if they were trade goods.

Council Keleres.Promissories.Keleres Rid.value: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 1 action card and gain 2 trade goods.
Then, return this card to the Keleres player.

Council Keleres.Tech Choice.value: Choose 2 non-faction technologies owned by other players.

Council Keleres.Techs.Agency Supply Netw.value: Whenever you resolve one of your PRODUCTION abilities, you may resolve an additional one of your PRODUCTION abilities in any system; the additional use does not trigger this ability.

Council Keleres.Techs.Executive Order.De.value: ACTION: Reveal the top or bottom card of the agenda deck and vote on it, being speaker. You may use trade goods to vote.

Council Keleres.Techs.I.I.H.Q. Moderniza.value: You are neighbors with all players that have units or control planets in or adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system.
Gain the Custodia Vigilia planet card and its legendary planet ability card. You cannot lose these cards, and this card cannot have an X or Y assimilator placed on it.

Council Keleres.Units.Artemiris.Descript.value: Other players must spend 2 influence to activate the system that contains this ship.

Council Keleres.Units.Artemiris.Omega.De.value: Other players must spend 2 influence to activate this system.

Council Keleres.Units.Omniopiares.Descri.value: Other players must spend 1 influence to commit ground forces to the planet that contains this unit.

Crimson Rebellion.Abilities.Incursion.De.value: When you activate a system that contains a breach, you may flip that breach; systems that contain active breaches are adjacent. At the end of the status phase, any player with ships in a system that contains an active breach may remove that breach.

Crimson Rebellion.Abilities.Sundered.Des.value: You cannot use wormholes other than epsilon wormholes. Other players' units that move or are placed into your home system are destroyed.

Crimson Rebellion.Abilities.The Sorrow.D.value: When you create the game board, place The Sorrow (tile 94) where your home system would be placed, and place an active breach in it. The Sorrow is not a home system. Then, place your home system (tile 118) in your play area.

Crimson Rebellion.Breakthrough.Resonance.value: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains an active breach.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to flip any breach or place an active breach in a non-home system that contains your units.

Crimson Rebellion.Leaders.Ahk Ravin.Desc.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose 1 player. That player may swap the position of 2 of their ships in any systems; they may transport units when they swap.

Crimson Rebellion.Leaders.Ahk Siever.Des.value: At the end of a combat between any players:
Gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

Crimson Rebellion.Leaders.Ahk Siever.Unl.value: Place a breach token in a system that contains another player's unit.

Crimson Rebellion.Leaders.Homesick Phant.value: You may place any of those ships onto this card.
At the start of a space combat, you may purge this card to place all ships from this card into the active system.

Crimson Rebellion.Promissories.Sever.Des.value: ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area and place the sever token in a system that contains your units; wormholes in that system have no effect during movement.
Remove the sever token and return this card to the Rebellion player at the end of the status phase.

Crimson Rebellion.Tech Choice.value: Choose one blue or red technology with no prerequisites.

Crimson Rebellion.Techs.Exile II.Descrip.value: At the end of any player's combat in this unit's system or up to 2 systems away, you may place 1 active or inactive breach in that system.

Crimson Rebellion.Techs.Subatomic Splice.value: When one of your ships is destroyed, you may produce a ship of the same type at a space dock in your home system.

Crimson Rebellion.Units.Exile I.Descript.value: At the end of any player's combat in this unit's system or an adjacent system, you may place 1 inactive breach in that system.

Crimson Rebellion.Units.Quietus.Descript.value: While this unit is in a system that contains an active breach, other players' units in systems with active breaches lose all of their unit abilities.

Crimson Rebellion.Units.Revenant.Descrip.value: DEPLOY: During the "Commit Ground Forces" step of your tactical action in a system that contains an active breach, you may commit 1 mech, even if you have no units in the system.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Abilities.Oceanbo.value: When your units begin coexisting on a planet, gain an ocean card and ready it. Any time you have more ocean cards than there are planets that have your coexisting units, discard ocean cards until you do not.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Abilities.Researc.value: When ground forces are committed, if your units on the planet are not already coexisting, you may choose for your units to coexist.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Breakthrough.Visi.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to allow each other player to spend 3 trade goods and give you 1 promissory note. Each player that does may research a non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology. You also gain each technology researched this way.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Leaders.Aello.Des.value: When another player spends resources to research a technology:
That player may reduce the cost by 1, if they do, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Leaders.Aello.Unl.value: Have an ocean card in play.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Leaders.Doctor Ca.value: When another player researches a technology:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to ignore 1 prerequisite; if they do, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements into coexistence on a non-home planet they control.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Leaders.Ta Zern.D.value: ACTION: Purge this card and a non-unit upgrade technology you own or from your deck; then, purge all cards with the same name owned by other players and in other players' decks.
Then, each player that purged a technology they owned researches another technology.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Promissories.Shar.value: ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area and gain 1 non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology that the Deepwrought player owns; place that technology on this card.
Return that technology to the deck and this card to the Deepwrought player at the end of the status phase.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Techs.Hydrotherma.value: At the start of the status phase, gain 1 trade good for each ocean card in play.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Techs.Radical Adv.value: At the start of the status phase, you may replace one of your non-unit upgrade technologies with a technology of the same color that has exactly 1 more prerequisite.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Units.D.W.S Lumin.value: This ship can move through systems that contain your units, even if other players units are present: if it would, apply +1 to its move value for each of those systems.

Deepwrought Scholarate.Units.Eanautic.De.value: When another player activates this system, if this unit is coexisting, you may move it and any of your infantry on its planet to a planet you control in your home system.

El Nen Janovet.Units.Analyzer.Descriptio.value: After you win a ground combat in which this unit participated, you may return this unit to your reinforcements to draw 1 unit upgrade.

El Nen Janovet.Units.The Faces of Janove.value: This unit gains the unit abilities and text abilities of your destroyer, cruiser, and dreadnought unit upgrade technologies.

Embers of Muaat.Abilities.Gashlai Physio.value: Your ships can move through supernovas.

Embers of Muaat.Abilities.Star Forge.Des.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your war suns.

Embers of Muaat.Breakthrough.Stellar Gen.value: When you gain this card, place the Avernus planet token into a non-home system that is adjacent to a planet you control; gain control of and ready it.
After you move 1 of your War Suns out of or through Avernus's system and into a non-home system, you may move the Avernus token with it.

Embers of Muaat.Leaders.Adjudicator Ba'a.value: After you move a war sun into a non-home system other than Mecatol Rex:

You may destroy all other players' units in that system and replace that system tile with the Muaat supernova tile. If you do, purge this card and each planet card that corresponds to the replaced system tile.

Embers of Muaat.Leaders.Magmus.Descripti.value: After you spend a token from your strategy pool:

Embers of Muaat.Leaders.Umbat.Descriptio.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may produce up to 2 units that each have a cost of 4 or less in a system that contains one of their war suns or their flagship

Embers of Muaat.Promissories.Fires of th.value: ACTION: Remove 1 token from the Muaat player's fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, gain your war sun unit upgrade technology card. Then, return this card to the Muaat player.

Embers of Muaat.Techs.Magmus Reactor.Des.value: Your ships can move into supernovas.
After 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION in a system that either contains a war sun or is adjacent to a supernova, gain 1 trade good.

Embers of Muaat.Techs.Magmus Reactor.Ome.value: Your ships can move into supernovas.
Each supernova that contains 1 or more of your units gains the PRODUCTION 5 ability as if it were one of your units.

Embers of Muaat.Techs.Prototype War Sun.value: Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

Embers of Muaat.Units.Ember Colossus.Des.value: When you use your STAR FORGE faction ability in this system or an adjacent system, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements with this unit.

Embers of Muaat.Units.Prototype War Sun.value: Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

Embers of Muaat.Units.The Inferno.Descri.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 cruiser in this unit's system.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Arbiters.Des.value: When you are negotiating a transaction, action cards can be exchanged as part of that transaction.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Guild Ships..value: You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Masters of T.value: You do not have to spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the "Trade" strategy card.

Emirates of Hacan.Breakthrough.Auto-Fact.value: When you produce 3 or more non-fighter ships, place 1 command token from your reinforcements into your fleet pool.

Emirates of Hacan.Leaders.Carth of Golde.value: You may exhaust this card to gain 2 commodities or replenish another player's commodities.

Emirates of Hacan.Leaders.Gila the Silve.value: You may spend any number of trade goods; cast 2 additional votes for each trade good spent.

Emirates of Hacan.Leaders.Harrugh Gefhar.value: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION:
You may reduce the cost of each of your units to 0 during this use of PRODUCTION. If you do, purge this card.

Emirates of Hacan.Promissories.Trade Con.value: ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, you may negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Hacan player's units, return this card to the Hacan player.

Emirates of Hacan.Techs.Production Biome.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to gain 4 trade goods and choose 1 other player; that player gains 2 trade goods.

Emirates of Hacan.Techs.Quantum Datahub.value: At the end of the strategy phase, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool and give another player 3 of your trade goods. If you do, give 1 of your strategy cards to that player and take 1 of their strategy cards.

Emirates of Hacan.Units.Pride of Kenara..value: This planet's card may be traded as part of a transaction; if you do, move all of your units from this planet to another planet you control.

Emirates of Hacan.Units.Wrath of Kenara..value: After you roll a die during a space combat in this system, you may spend 1 trade good to apply +1 to the result.

Empyrean.Abilities.Aetherpassage.Descrip.value: After a player activates a system, you may allow that player to move their ships through systems that contain your ships.

Empyrean.Abilities.Dark Whispers.Descrip.value: During setup, take the additional Empyrean faction promissory note; you have 2 faction promissory notes.

Empyrean.Abilities.Voidborn.Description.value: Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement.

Empyrean.Breakthrough.Void Tether.Descri.value: When you activate a system that contains or is adjacent to a unit or planet you control, you may place or move 1 of your void tether tokens onto a border that system shares with another system; other players do not treat those systems as adjacent to each other unless you allow it.

Empyrean.Leaders.Acamar.Description.value: After a player moves ships into a system that does not contain any planets:
You may exhaust this card; that player gains 1 command token.

Empyrean.Leaders.Conservator Procyon.Des.value: ACTION: Place 1 frontier token in each system that does not contain any planets and does not already have a frontier token. Then, explore each frontier token that is in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

Empyrean.Leaders.Xuange.Description.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 of your command tokens:
You may return that token to your reinforcements.

Empyrean.Leaders.Xuange.Unlock.value: Be neighbors with all other players.

Empyrean.Promissories.Blood Pact.Descrip.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you and the Empyrean player cast votes for the same outcome, cast 4 additional votes for that outcome.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Empyrean.Promissories.Dark Pact.Descript.value: ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you give a number of commodities to the Empyrean player equal to your maximum commodity value, you each gain 1 trade good.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Empyrean.Techs.Aetherstream.Description.value: After you or one of your neighbors activates a system that is adjacent to an anomaly, you may apply +1 to the move value of all of that player's ships during this tactical action.

Empyrean.Techs.Voidwatch.Description.value: After a player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units, they must give you 1 promissory note from their hand, if able.

Empyrean.Units.Dynamo.Description.value: After any player's unit in this system or an adjacent system uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE, you may spend 2 influence to repair that unit.

Empyrean.Units.Watcher.Description.value: You may remove this unit from a system that contains or is adjacent to another player's units to cancel an action card played by that player.

Events.Advent of the War Sun.Description.value: At the end of setup, all players other than the Embers of Muaat player gain the War Sun unit upgrade technology.
The Embers of Muaat player purges their faction-specific promissory note, unlocks their commander, and places 1 additional War Sun in their home system.

Events.Age of Commerce.Description.value: Players do not have to be neighbors to perform transactions with each other.
Players do not have a maximum number of commodities; when they refresh commodities, they gain a number of commodities equal to their commodities value instead.

Players can share non-faction technology with other players as part of a transaction. When sharing technology, the receiving player gains that technology from their own deck; the sharing player does not lose the technology.

Events.Age of Exploration.Description.value: Relics only require 2 matching fragments be purged instead of 3.
The Naaz-Rokha Alliance's FABRICATION faction ability and BLACK MARKET FORGERY promissory note do not require purged fragments to match.
All players can perform the following action:

ACTION: Exhaust DARK ENERGY TAP and choose a non-home edge system that contains your ships to roll a 1 die. On a result of 1 - 4, draw a random unused red tile; on a result of 5 - 10, draw an random unused blue tile. Place that tile adjacent to the chosen system so that it is touching 2 non-home systems. Place a frontier token in the system if it does not contain any planets.

Events.Age of Fighters.Description.value: During setup, all players gain the Fighter II unit upgrade technology; the Naalu Collective player gains Hybrid Crystal Fighter II technology instead.
Fighters that count against your fleet pool have CAPACITY value of 1; fighters cannot transport other fighters.
Non-fighter ships are purged when they are destroyed.

Events.Call of the Void.Description.value: After you move 1 or more units into the active system, if that system is in The Fracture, gain 1 command token.
When you activate a system in The Fracture, apply +1 to the move values of each of your ships.

Events.Civilized Society.Description.value: During setup, turn all public objectives faceup.
There is no limit to the number of public objectives a player may score during the status phase.

The game does not immediately end when a player reaches the required number of victory points; instead, it ends at the end of that round's status phase, and the player with the most victory points wins. In the case of a tie, the tied players total the influence values of their controlled planets and their unspent trade goods; the player or players with the highest total win the game.

Events.Conventions of War Abandoned.Desc.value: Each hit produced by BOMBARDMENT rolls destroys 3 units instead of 1.
Players that have the X-89 BACTERIAL WEAPON technology can perform the following action:

ACTION: Exhaust X-89 BACTERIAL WEAPON to choose 1 planet in a system that contains 1 of your units that has BOMBARDMENT; purge its planet card and all attachments or legendary planet ability cards associated with it.
You are eliminated if all of your home system's planet cards are purged.

Events.Cosmic Phenomenae.Description.value: Nebulae: The defender applies +3 to each of their ship's combat rolls in the nebula instead.
Asteroid Fields: Fighters without a move value do not participate in space combat in asteroid fields.
Supernovas: Units with PRODUCTION in or adjacent to supernovas have their PRODUCTION values increased by 1.
Gravity Rifts: You may apply an additional +1 to the MOVE values of any of your ships moving out of gravity rifts; if you do, those ships are removed on a roll of 5 or lower.
Entropic Scar: Systems that contain entropic scars are adjacent to each other.

Events.Cultural Exchange Program.Descrip.value: At the end of setup, shuffle the reference cards that correspond to each faction in play. Each player draws 1 of those cards and takes all leaders that correspond to that faction. They belong to that player for the remainder of the game. Then, each player unlocks their commander.
The Obsidian/Firmament player does not participate in the Cultural Exchange Program. Instead, they begin the game with "The Obsidian" relic.

Events.Dangerous Wilds.Description.value: During setup, place neutral infantry on each hazardous planet equal to that planet's resource value.
At the end of each round, for each hazardous planet that is not controlled, replenish any neutral units that were destroyed during the game round.

When a player gains control of a hazardous planet from the planet deck, they may research 1 technology; they may ignore a number of that technology's prerequisites equal to the planet's resource value.
