Events.Hidden Agenda.Description.value: During the agenda phase, only the speaker can talk; all other players must remain silent except when declaring action cards. Transactions cannot be performed during this phase.

When voting, players secretly and simultaneously write their desired outcome and number of votes and pass them to the speaker. After all players have voted, the speaker secretly tallies the results and reveals only the totals to the other players; the speaker reveals who voted for which outcome only when required to resolve the outcome.
The Argent Flight's votes are public and are known before the other players vote.

Events.Mercenaries for Hire.Description.value: At the start of the game, shuffle the alliance cards that correspond to the factions not in play and place them in the common play area with the cards fronts faceup; this is the mercenary deck.
All players can perform the following action:
ACTION: Spend 3 trade goods to gain the top card of the mercenary deck and place it in your play area.
Players can use the abilities of the mercenaries in their play area.

Events.Minor Factions.Description.value: During setup, players are dealt 1 fewer blue tile. Before creating the galaxy, shuffle the reference cards for factions not being played and deal 1 to each player. In speaker order, each player places that faction's home system in the second ring, equidistant from players' home systems. Then, that player places 3 neutral infantry on that system's planets, split as evenly as possible. These systems are minor faction systems and do not count as home systems.
When a player controls each planet in a minor faction system, they take that factions alliance card from the deck or from the player that owned it previously.
Planets in minor faction systems gain all three planet traits (cultural, industrial, and hazardous).

Events.Monuments to the Ages.Description.value: When you would place a structure on a non-home planet, you may spend 5 trade goods to place a neutral space dock instead; this is a monument, and is not considered to be a unit of any type. There can be only 3 monuments in play at once.
At the start of the status phase, place 1 commodity beneath each monument; each monument is worth 1 victory point to the player that controls its planet for every 3 commodities beneath it.
When a player gains control of a planet that contains a monument, they may destroy that monument.

Events.Rapid Mobilization.Description.value: After setup, put The Fracture into play. Then, each player simultaneously resolves the following effects in order:
Place 1 infantry onto each planet adjacent to your home system (or the Creuss Gate/The Sorrow, if playing those factions); gain control of and ready those planets but do not explore them.
Place 1 space dock on any planet you control and place your flagship and 3 fighters in its system.
Research 1 technology; if you are the Nomad player, research 1 additional technology.

Events.Stellar Atomics.Description.value: During setup, each player places one of their control tokens on this card.
All players can perform the following action:
ACTION: Discard your control token from this card to destroy all ground forces and structures on any non-home planet.
If you do not have a control token on this card, you cannot vote or play action cards during the agenda phase.

Events.Total War.Description.value: When a player destroys or produces a hit that destroys another player's units, they place commodities from the supply equal to the combined cost of the units they destroyed on a planet they control in their home system (infantry and fighters are worth 1 each).
When a player gains control of a home system that has commodities, they move those commodities to a planet they control in their own home system.
All players can perform the following action:
ACTION: Discard 10 commodities from planets in your home system to gain 1 victory point.

Events.Weird Wormholes.Description.value: After a ship moves using at least 1 alpha, beta, or gamma wormhole, roll 1 die and consult the following list.
Fighter > Destroyer > Cruiser > Dreadnought > Carrier > Flagship > War Sun (if researched)
For each result of 1-5, replace that ship with the ship before it from your reinforcements, if able.
For each result of 6-10, replace that ship with the ship after it from your reinforcements, if able.
If there are no ships of that type in your reinforcements, skip that type and replace it with the next available type.

Events.Wild Wild Galaxy.Description.value: Action cards are adjusted as follows:
br
Direct Hit: Can be used against mechs
nl
Flank Speed: Applies +2 MOVE instead of +1
nl
Maneuvering Jets: Cancels all SPACE CANNON hits
nl
Morale Boost: Applies +2 to die rolls instead of +1
nl
Sabotage: Also take the canceled action card
nl
Shields Holding: Can be used in ground combat
nl
Skilled Retreat: Does not place a command token
nl
War Machine: Reduces cost by 5 instead of 1
nl
Diplomatic Pressure: Player must give 3 notes
br
Additionally, Stellar Converter and Nova Seed can be used against any planets and systems.

Events.Zealous Orthodoxy.Description.value: The first player to score 2 secret objectives gains 1 victory point.
Then, place that faction's alliance card on this card; all players gain that ability. That faction's alliance promissory note is then purged.

Federation of Sol.Abilities.Orbital Drop.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

Federation of Sol.Abilities.Versatile.De.value: When you gain command tokens during the status phase, gain 1 additional command token.

Federation of Sol.Breakthrough.Bellum Gl.value: When you produce a ship that has capacity, you may also produce any combination of ground forces or fighters up to that ship's capacity; they do not count against your PRODUCTION limit.

Federation of Sol.Leaders.Claire Gibson..value: At the start of a ground combat on a planet you control:
You may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.
Control planets that have a combined total of at least 12 resources.

Federation of Sol.Leaders.Evelyn Delouis.value: At the start of a ground combat round:
You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ground force in the active system; that ground force rolls 1 additional die during that combat round.

Federation of Sol.Leaders.Jace X. 4th Ai.value: ACTION: Remove each of your command tokens from the game board and return them to your reinforcements.

Federation of Sol.Promissories.Military.value: At the start of the Sol player's turn:
Remove 1 token from the Sol player's strategy pool, if able, and return it to their reinforcements. Then, you may place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.
Then return this card to the Sol player.

Federation of Sol.Techs.Spec Ops II.Desc.value: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Federation of Sol.Units.Genesis.Descript.value: At the end of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements in this system's space area.

Federation of Sol.Units.ZS Thunderbolt M.value: DEPLOY: After you use your ORBITAL DROP faction ability, you may spend 3 resources to place 1 mech on that planet.

Firmament.Abilities.Plots Within Plots.D.value: You can score secret objectives already scored by other players if you fulfill their requirements; this does not count against your secret objective limit or the number you can score in a round. When you score another player's secret objective, do not gain a victory point; instead, place a facedown plot card into your play area with that player's control token on it.

Firmament.Abilities.Puppets of the Blade.value: If you have at least 1 plot card in your play area, gain the following ability:
ACTION: Purge The Firmament's faction sheet, leaders, planet cards, and promissory note. Then, gain all of the faction components for The Obsidian.

Firmament.Breakthrough.The Sowing.Descri.value: When you gain this card and at the start of the status phase, you may place up to 3 of your trade goods on this card.
Flip this card if you become the Obsidian faction.

Firmament.Leaders.Captain Aroz.Descripti.value: You may treat planets in systems that contain your ships as if you controlled them for the purpose of scoring secret objectives.

Firmament.Leaders.Captain Aroz.Unlock.value: Have a plot card in play.

Firmament.Leaders.Myru Vos.Description.value: You may exhaust this card; if you do, SPACE CANNON cannot be used against those ships. If they are not transporting units, they can also move through other players' ships.

Firmament.Leaders.Sharsiss.Description.value: ACTION: Place 1 of your plot cards in play with any other player's control token on it. Then, you may place any player's control token on 1 of your in-play plot cards; one plot cannot have two of the same player's tokens.

Firmament.Promissories.Black Ops.Descrip.value: When you receive this card, if you are not the Firmament:
The Firmament player may place 1 facedown plot card in their play area with your control token on it. Then, gain 2 command tokens, gain 2 trade goods, and purge this card.

Firmament.Tech Choice.value: Choose one green or yellow technology that has no prerequisites.

Firmament.Techs.Neural Parasite.Descript.value: At the start of the status phase, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on a planet you control in your home system.
Flip this card if the Obsidian faction is in play.

Firmament.Techs.Planesplitter.Descriptio.value: When you gain this card, put The Fracture into play.
Flip this card if the Obsidian faction is in play.

Firmament.Units.Heaven's Eye.Description.value: If the active system contains units that belong to a player who has a control token on 1 of your plots, apply +1 to this ship's move value and repair it at the end of every combat round.

Firmament.Units.Viper EX-23.Description.value: When ground forces are committed to this planet, you may choose for your units to coexist, if they were not already. Flip this card if your faction becomes the Obsidian.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Creuss Gate.D.value: When you create the game board, place the Creuss Gate (tile 17) where your home system would normally be placed. The Creuss Gate system is not a home system. Then, place your home system (tile 51) in your play area.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Quantum Entan.value: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Slipstream.De.value: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains either an alpha or beta wormhole.

Ghosts of Creuss.Breakthrough.Particle S.value: Each wormhole in a system that contains your ships gains PRODUCTION 1 as if it were a unit you control.
Reduce the combined cost of units you produce in systems that contain wormholes by 1 for each wormhole in that system.

Ghosts of Creuss.Leaders.Emissary Taivra.value: After a player activates a system that contains a non-delta wormhole:
You may exhaust this card; if you do, that system is adjacent to all other systems that contain a wormhole during this tactical action.

Ghosts of Creuss.Leaders.Riftwalker Meia.value: ACTION: Swap the positions of any 2 systems that contain wormholes or your units, other than the Creuss system and the Wormhole Nexus.

Ghosts of Creuss.Leaders.Sai Seravus.Des.value: For each ship that has a capacity value and moved through 1 or more wormholes, you may place 1 fighter from your reinforcements with that ship if you have unused capacity in the active system.

Ghosts of Creuss.Leaders.Sai Seravus.Unl.value: Have units in 3 systems that contain alpha or beta wormholes.

Ghosts of Creuss.Promissories.Creuss Iff.value: At the start of your turn during the action phase:
Place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.
Then, return this card to the Creuss player.

Ghosts of Creuss.Techs.Dimensional Splic.value: At the start of space combat in a system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of your ships, you may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships.

Ghosts of Creuss.Techs.Wormhole Generato.value: At the start of the status phase, place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.

Ghosts of Creuss.Units.Hil Colish.Descri.value: This ship's system contains a delta wormhole. During movement, this ship may move before or after your other ships.

Ghosts of Creuss.Units.Icarus Drive.Desc.value: After any player activates a system, you may remove this unit from the game board to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into this system.

Il Na Viroset.Units.Enigma.Description.value: This unit ignores the effects of all anomalies. Its MOVE value is reduced by 1 for each unit it would transport.

Il Na Viroset.Units.Starlancer XI.Descri.value: This unit participates in space combat as if it were a ship. For each anomaly this unit is in or adjacent to, apply +1 to this unit's combat rolls.

Il Sai Lakoe.Name.value: Il Sai Lakoe, Herald of Thorns

Il Sai Lakoe.Units.Lakoe's Roots.Descrip.value: When this unit is produced, place it on any planet you control.

Il Sai Lakoe.Units.Nightbloom.Descriptio.value: When this unit moves, you may resolve the PRODUCTION abilities of your units in the system it started in and each system it moved through.

KzTGw5.value: Veto or Quash or Political Favor

L1Z1X Mindnet.Abilities.Assimilate.Descr.value: When you gain control of a planet, replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Abilities.Harrow.Descripti.value: At the end of each round of ground combat, your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Breakthrough.Fealty Uplink.value: When you gain control of a planet, place infantry from your reinforcements equal to that planet's influence value onto that planet.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Leaders.2RAM.Description.value: Units that have PLANETARY SHIELD do not prevent you from using BOMBARDMENT.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Leaders.I48S.Description.value: After a player activates a system:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to replace 1 of their infantry in the active system with 1 mech from their reinforcements.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Leaders.The Helmsman.Descr.value: ACTION: Choose 1 system that does not contain other players' ships; you may move your flagship and any number of your dreadnoughts from other systems into the chosen system.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Promissories.Cybernetic En.value: At the start of your turn:
Remove 1 token from the L1Z1X player's strategy pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, place 1 command token from your reinforcements in your strategy pool.
Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.
When you gain command tokens during the status phase:
Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Techs.Inheritance Systems..value: You may exhaust this card and spend 2 resources when you research a technology; ignore all of that technology's prerequisites.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Techs.Super-Dreadnought II.value: "Direct Hit" cards are no longer effective against this type of ship.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Units.Annihilator.Descript.value: While not participating in ground combat, this unit can use its BOMBARDMENT ability on planets in its system as if it were a ship.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Units.[0.0.1].Description.value: During a space combat, hits produced by this ship and by your dreadnoughts in this system must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.

Last Bastion.Abilities.Galvanize.Descrip.value: When a game effect instructs a player to galvanize a unit, they place a galvanize token beneath it if it does not have one. Galvanized units roll 1 additional die for combat rolls and unit abilities.

Last Bastion.Abilities.Liberate.Descript.value: When you gain control of a planet, ready that planet if it contains a number of your Infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 Infantry on that planet.

Last Bastion.Abilities.Pheonix Standard..value: At the end of combat, you may galvanize 1 of your units that participated.

Last Bastion.Breakthrough.The Icon.Descr.value: When you produce ships, you may exhaust this card to place those ships in a system that contains 1 of your command tokens, at least 1 of your ground forces, and no other player's ships.

Last Bastion.Leaders.Dame Briar.Descript.value: When a player's unit is destroyed:
you may exhaust this card to galvanize another of that player's units in the destroyed unit's system.

Last Bastion.Leaders.Lyra Keen.Descripti.value: When one of your galvanized units is destroyed:
You may purge this card to roll 1 die for each unit in its system that belongs to another player; if the result is equal to or greater than the galvanized unit's combat value, destroy that unit.

Last Bastion.Leaders.Nip and Tuck.Descri.value: Your action cards cannot be canceled by "Sabotage" action cards.
The Nekro Virus cannot place assimilator tokens on your components.

Last Bastion.Leaders.Nip and Tuck.Unlock.value: There are 3 galvanized units on the game board.

Last Bastion.Promissories.Raise the Stan.value: At the end of a combat:
Galvanize 1 of your units that participated.
Then, return this card to the Last Bastion player.

Last Bastion.Tech Choice.value: Choose 1 blue or yellow technology with no prerequisites.

Last Bastion.Techs.Proxima Targeting VI..value: Cancel 1 hit produced by BOMBARDMENT rolls made against your ground forces for each of your galvanized units present.
At the start of a round of ground combat, you may resolve BOMBARDMENT 8 (x3) against your opponent's ground forces; if you do, make an identical roll against your own ground forces.

Last Bastion.Units.4X41C \"Helios\" V1.D.value: This unit's PRODUCTION value is equal to 2 more than the resource value of this planet.
The resource value of this planet is increased by 1.
Up to 3 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.

Last Bastion.Units.A3 Valiance.Descripti.value: When this unit is destroyed, if it was galvanized, galvanize up to 3 of your infantry in its system.

Last Bastion.Units.The Egeiro.Descriptio.value: Apply +1 to the result of each of this unit's combat rolls for each non-home system that contains a planet you control.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Edict.De.value: When you win a combat, place 1 command token from your opponent's reinforcements in your fleet pool if it does not already contain 1 of that player's tokens; other player's tokens in your fleet pool increase your fleet limit but cannot be redistributed.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Hubris.D.value: During setup, purge your "Alliance" promissory note. Other players cannot give you their "Alliance" promissory note.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Imperia..value: While another player's command token is in your fleet pool, you can use the ability of that player's commander, if it is unlocked.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Breakthrough.Vault.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and purge 1 of your technologies to gain 1 relic.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Leaders.Airo Shir.value: ACTION: Move all units in the space area of any system to an adjacent system that contains a different player's ships. Space Combat is resolved in that system; neither player can retreat or resolve abilities that would move their ships

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Leaders.Il Na Viro.value: During your tactical actions, you can activate systems that contain your command tokens. If you do, return both command tokens to your reinforcements and end your turn.
Have 2 other factions' command tokens in your fleet pool.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Leaders.Jae Mir Ka.value: When you would spend a command token during the secondary ability of a strategic action:
You may exhaust this card to remove 1 of the active player's command tokens from the board and use it instead.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Promissories.Scept.value: At the start of the strategy phase:
Choose 1 non-home system that contains your units; each other player who has a token on the Mahact player's command sheet places a token from their reinforcements in that system
Then, return this card to the Mahact player.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Techs.Crimson Legi.value: After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good. Then, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Techs.Genetic Reco.value: You may exhaust this card before a player casts votes; that player must cast at least 1 vote for an outcome of your choice or remove 1 token from their fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Arvicon Rex..value: During combat against an opponent whose command token is not in your fleet pool, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Crimson Legi.value: After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Starlancer.D.value: After a player whose command token is in your fleet pool activates this system, you may spend their token from your fleet pool to end their turn; they gain that token.

Mentak Coalition.Abilities.Ambush.Descri.value: At the start of a space combat, you may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of their ships.

Mentak Coalition.Abilities.Pillage.Descr.value: After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction, if they have 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of their trade goods or commodities.

Mentak Coalition.Breakthrough.The Table'.value: If you have the Cruiser II unit upgrade technology, flip this card and place it on top of Cruiser II.

Mentak Coalition.Leaders.Ipswitch, Loose.value: At the start of space combat that you are participating in:
You may purge this card; if you do, for each other player's ship that is destroyed during this combat, place 1 ship of that type from your reinforcements in the active system.

Mentak Coalition.Leaders.S'Ula Mentarion.value: After you win a space combat:
You may force your opponent to give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
Have 4 cruisers on the game board.

Mentak Coalition.Leaders.Suffi An.Descri.value: After the PILLAGE faction ability is used against another player:
You may exhaust this card; if you do, you and that player each draw 1 action card.

Mentak Coalition.Promissories.Promise of.value: ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Mentak player cannot use their PILLAGE faction ability against you.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Mentak player's units, return this card to the Mentak player.

Mentak Coalition.Techs.Mirror Computing..value: When you spend trade goods, each trade good is worth 2 resources or influence instead of 1.

Mentak Coalition.Techs.Salvage Operation.value: After you win or lose a space combat, gain 1 trade good; if you won the combat you may also produce 1 ship in that system of any ship type that was destroyed during the combat.

Mentak Coalition.Units.Corsair.Descripti.value: If the active system contains another player's non-fighter ships, this unit can move through systems that contain other players' ships.

Mentak Coalition.Units.Fourth Moon.Descr.value: Other players' ships in this system cannot use SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

Mentak Coalition.Units.Moll Terminus.Des.value: Other players' ground forces on this planet cannot use SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

Naalu Collective.Abilities.Foresight.Des.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, you may place 1 token from your strategy pool in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.

Naalu Collective.Abilities.Telepathic.De.value: At the end of the strategy phase, place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.

Naalu Collective.Breakthrough.Mindsieve..value: When you would resolve the secondary ability of another player's strategy card, you may give them a promissory note to resolve it without spending a command token.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.M'aban.Descript.value: You may produce 1 additional fighter for their cost; these additional units do not count against your production limit.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.M'aban.Omega.De.value: You may look at your neighbors' hand of promissory notes and the top and bottom cards of the agenda deck.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.M'aban.Omega.Un.value: Have ground forces in or adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.M'aban.Unlock.value: Have 12 fighters on the game board.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.The Oracle.Desc.value: At the end of the status phase:
You may force each other player to give you 1 promissory note from their hand. If you do, purge this card.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.Z'eu.Descriptio.value: You may exhaust this card to look at the top card of the agenda deck. Then, you may show that card to 1 other player

Naalu Collective.Leaders.Z'eu.Omega.Desc.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose a player; that player may perform a tactical action in a non-home system without placing a command token; that system still counts as being activated

Naalu Collective.Leaders.Z'eu.TE.Descrip.value: After any player's command token is placed in a system:
You may exhaust this card to return that token to that player's reinforcements.

Naalu Collective.Promissories.Gift of Pr.value: At the end of the strategy phase:

Place this card face-up in your play area and place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in the initiative order. The Naalu player cannot use their TELEPATHIC faction ability during this game round.
Return this card to the Naalu player at the end of the status phase.

Naalu Collective.Techs.Hybrid Crystal Fi.value: This unit may move without being transported. Each fighter in excess of your ships' capacity counts as 1/2 of a ship against your fleet pool

Naalu Collective.Techs.Neuroglaive.Descr.value: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, that player removes 1 token from their fleet pool and returns it to their reinforcements.

Naalu Collective.Units.Iconoclast.Descri.value: During combat against an opponent who has at least 1 relic fragment, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls.

Naalu Collective.Units.Iconoclast.Omega..value: Other players cannot use ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE against your units in this system.

Naalu Collective.Units.Iconoclast.TE.Des.value: DEPLOY: When another player gains a relic, place 1 mech on any planet you control.

Naalu Collective.Units.Matriarch.Descrip.value: During an invasion in this system, you may commit fighters to planets as if they were ground forces. When combat ends, return those units to the space area.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Abilities.Distant Su.value: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs, you may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Breakthrough.Absolut.value: When you have 4 mechs in the same system, you may return 3 of those mechs to your reinforcements to flip this card and place it on top of your mech card.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Leaders.Dart and Tai.value: After you gain control of a planet that was controlled by another player:

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Leaders.Garv and Gun.value: At the end of a player's turn:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to explore 1 of their planets.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Leaders.Hesh and Pri.value: ACTION: Gain 1 relic and perform the secondary ability of up to 2 readied or unchosen strategy cards; during this action, spend command tokens from your reinforcements instead of your strategy pool.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Promissories.Black M.value: ACTION: Purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic.
Then return this card to the Naaz-Rokha player.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Techs.Pre-Fab Arcolo.value: After you explore a planet, ready that planet.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Techs.Supercharge.De.value: At the start of a combat round, you may exhaust this card to apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Eidolon Maximu.value: This unit is both a ship and a ground force. It cannot be assigned hits from unit abilities. Repair it at the start of every combat round. Game effects cannot place or produce your mechs. When this unit is destroyed or removed, flip this card and return it to your play area.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Eidolon.Descri.value: If this unit is in the space area of the active system at the start of a space combat, flip this card.
(This card begins the game with this side face up)

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Visz el Vir.De.value: Your mechs in this system roll 1 additional die during combat.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Z-Grav Eidolon.value: If this unit is in the space area of the active system, it is also a ship. At the end of a space battle in the active system, flip this card.
(This card begins the game with this side face down)

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Galactic Threat.De.value: You cannot vote on agendas. Once per agenda phase, after an agenda is revealed, you may predict aloud the outcome of that agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 technology that is owned by a player who voted how you predicted.

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Propagation.Descri.value: You cannot research technology. When you would research a technology, gain 3 command tokens instead.

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Technological Sing.value: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed, you may gain 1 technology that is owned by that player.

Nekro Virus.Breakthrough.Valefar Assimil.value: When you would gain another player's technology using one of your faction abilities, you may instead place one of your "Z" assimilator tokens on that player's faction sheet. Your flagship gains the text abilities of that faction's flagship in addition to its own.

Nekro Virus.Leaders.Nekro Acidos.Unlock.value: Own 3 technologies. A "Valefar Assimilator" technology counts only if its X or Y token is on a technology.

Nekro Virus.Leaders.Nekro Malleon.Descri.value: You may exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may discard 1 action card or spend 1 command token from their command sheet to gain 2 trade goods.

Nekro Virus.Leaders.UNIT.DSGN.FLAYESH.De.value: ACTION: Choose a planet that has a technology specialty in a system that contains your units. Destroy any other player's units on that planet. Gain trade goods equal to that planet's combined resource and influence values and gain 1 technology that matches the specialty of that planet.

Nekro Virus.Promissories.Antivirus.Descr.value: At the start of a combat:
Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Nekro player cannot use their TECHNOLOGICAL SINGULARITY faction ability against you.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Nekro player's units, return this card to the Nekro player.

Nekro Virus.Units.The Alastor.Descriptio.value: At the start of a space combat, choose any number of your ground forces in this system to participate in that combat as if they were ships.

Nomad.Abilities.Future Sight.Description.value: During the Agenda phase, after an outcome that you voted for or predicted is resolved, gain 1 trade good.

Nomad.Abilities.The Company.Description.value: During setup, take the 2 additional Nomad faction agents and place them next to your faction sheet; you have 3 agents.

Nomad.Breakthrough.Thunder's Paradox.Des.value: At the start of any player's turn, you may exhaust 1 of your agents to ready any other agent.

Nomad.Leaders.Ahk-Syl Siven.Description.value: ACTION: Place this card near the game board; your flagship and units it transports can move out of systems that contain your command tokens during this game round
At the end of that game round, purge this card

Nomad.Leaders.Artuno the Betrayer.Descri.value: When you gain trade goods from the supply:
You may exhaust this card to place an equal number of trade goods on this card. When this card readies, gain the trade goods on this card.

Nomad.Leaders.Field Marshal Mercer.Descr.value: At the end of a player's turn:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to remove up to 2 of their ground forces from the game board and place them on planets they control in the active system.

Nomad.Leaders.Navarch Feng.Description.value: You can produce your flagship without spending resources.

Nomad.Leaders.The Thundarian.Description.value: After the "Roll Dice" step of combat:
You may exhaust this card. If you do, hits are not assigned to either players' units. Return to the start of this combat round's "Roll Dice" step

Nomad.Promissories.The Cavalry.Descripti.value: At the start of a space combat against a player other than the Nomad:
During this combat, treat 1 of your non-fighter ships as if it has the SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability, combat value, and ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE value of the Nomad's flagship.
Return this card to the Nomad player at the end of this combat.

Nomad.Techs.Memoria II.Description.value: You may treat this unit as if it were adjacent to systems that contain 1 or more of your mechs.

Nomad.Techs.Temporal Command Suite.Descr.value: After any player's agent becomes exhausted, you may exhaust this card to ready that agent; if you ready another player's agent, you may perform a transaction with that player.

Nomad.Units.Memoria.Description.value: You may treat this unit as if it were adjacent to systems that contain 1 or more of your mechs.

Nomad.Units.Quantum Manipulator.Descript.value: While this unit is in a space area during combat, you may use its SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability to cancel a hit that is produced against your ships in this system.

Obsidian.Abilities.Nocturne.Description.value: This faction cannot be chosen during setup.

Obsidian.Leaders.Aroz Hollow.Description.value: Apply +1 to the result of each of your units' combat rolls in The Fracture.

Obsidian.Leaders.Sharsiss Hollow.Descrip.value: ACTION: Ready all of your planets.
