Planets.Ordinian.Ability.value: You may exhaust this card when you pass to draw 1 action card and gain 1 command token.

Planets.Primor.Ability.value: You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to place up to 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

Planets.Styx.Ability.value: When you gain this card, gain 1 victory point.
When you lose this card, lose 1 victory point.

Planets.Tempesta.Ability.value: You may exhaust this card after you activate a system to apply +1 to the move value of 1 of your ships during this tactical action.

Planets.Thunder's Edge.Ability.value: Gain your breakthrough when you gain this card if you do not already have it.
You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to perform an action.

Radiant Aur.Units.Airo Shir Rex.Descript.value: At the start of the edict phase, if this unit is on the game board, draw and resolve 1 edict.

Radiant Aur.Units.Starlancer II.Descript.value: At the start of each round of ground combat, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to repair all of your mechs.

Ral Nel Consortium.Abilities.Miniaturiza.value: Your structures can be transported by any ship; this does not require or count against capacity. While your structures are in the space area, they cannot use their unit abilities. At the end of your tactical actions, you may place your structures that are in space areas onto planets you control in their respective systems.

Ral Nel Consortium.Abilities.Survival In.value: After another player activates a system that contains your ships, you may move up to 2 of your ships into the active system from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens.

Ral Nel Consortium.Breakthrough.Data Ski.value: During the action phase, if you have not passed, when other players would discard action cards, they are placed on this card instead.
When you pass, take 1 action card from this card and discard the rest.

Ral Nel Consortium.Leaders.Director Nel..value: You may choose to no longer be passed; if you do, gain 2 command tokens, draw 1 action card, and purge this card.

Ral Nel Consortium.Leaders.Kan Kip Rel.D.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to draw 2 action cards; give 1 of those cards to another player.

Ral Nel Consortium.Leaders.Watchful Ojz..value: Immediately retreat up to 2 of your ships from the active system to an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. Place a command token from your reinforcements into that system.
Be the last player to pass during the action phase.

Ral Nel Consortium.Promissories.Nano-Lin.value: You may move your structures from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens onto planets you control in the active system.
Then, return this card to the Ral Nel player.

Ral Nel Consortium.Tech Choice.value: Choose 1 green or red technology with no prerequisites.

Ral Nel Consortium.Techs.Linkship II.Des.value: This unit can use the SPACE CANNON ability of one of your structures in its space area; each linkship can trigger the same structure.

Ral Nel Consortium.Techs.Nanomachines.De.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to place 1 PDS on a planet you control.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to repair all of your damaged units.
ACTION: Exhaust this card and discard 1 action card to draw 1 action card.

Ral Nel Consortium.Units.Alarum.Descript.value: At the end of a round of combat on this planet, you may move up to 2 of your ground forces to this planet from planets in adjacent systems.

Ral Nel Consortium.Units.Last Dispatch.D.value: When this unit retreats, you may destroy 1 ship in the active system that does not have SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

Ral Nel Consortium.Units.Linkship I.Desc.value: This unit can use the SPACE CANNON ability of one of your structures in its space area; each structure can only be triggered once.

Relics.Accretion Engine.Description.value: Apply +1 to the PRODUCTION value of each of your units with PRODUCTION. When you produce 1 or more units, reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.

Relics.Azdel's Key.Description.value: ACTION: Purge this card to draw 3 system tiles with a blue-colored back at random; place 1 of those tiles at the edge of the game board, adjacent to at least 2 other systems. Purge the rest.

Relics.Book of Latvinia.Description.value: When you gain this card, research up to 2 technologies that have no prerequisites.
ACTION: Purge this card; if you control planets that have all 4 types of technology specialties, gain 1 victory point. Otherwise, gain the speaker token.

Relics.Circlet of the Void.Description.value: Your units do not roll for gravity rifts, and you ignore the movement effects of other anomalies.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to explore a frontier token in a system that does not contain any other players' ships.

Relics.Dominus Orb.Description.value: Before you move units during a tactical action, you may purge this card to move and transport units that are in systems that contain 1 of your command tokens.

Relics.Dynamis Core.Description.value: While this card is in your play area, your commodity value is increased by 2.
ACTION: Gain trade goods equal to your commodity value, then purge this card.

Relics.E6-G0 Network.Description.value: You may have 2 additional action cards in your hand, game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.
At any time, you may exhaust this card to draw 1 action card.

Relics.Eye of Vogul.Description.value: Purge this card to treat 2 of your ships as adjacent to the active system until the end of this tactical action.

Relics.Forgotten Throne.Description.value: ACTION: Purge this card to either gain 1 relic or immediately score 1 scored secret objective, or 1 of your unscored secret objectives, if you fulfill its requirements.

Relics.Heart of Ixth.Description.value: After any die is rolled, you may exhaust this card to add or subtract 1 from its result.

Relics.JR-XS455-O.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this agent and choose a player; that player may spend 3 resources to place a structure on a planet they control. If they do not, they gain 1 trade good.

Relics.Lightrail Ordnance.Description.value: Your space docks gain SPACE CANNON 5 (x2). You may use your space dock's SPACE CANNON against ships that are adjacent to their systems.

Relics.Maw of Worlds.Description.value: At the start of the agenda phase, you may purge this card and exhaust all of your planets to gain any 1 technology.

Relics.Metali Void Armaments.Description.value: During the "Anti-Fighter Barrage" step of space combat, you may resolve ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE 6 (x3) against your opponent's units.

Relics.Metali Void Shielding.Description.value: Each time hits are produced against 1 or more of your non-fighter ships, 1 of those ships may use SUSTAIN DAMAGE as if it had that ability.

Relics.Nano-Forge.Description.value: ACTION: Attach this card to a non-legendary, non-home planet you control; its resource and influence values are increased by 2 and it is a legendary planet. This action cannot be performed once attached.

Relics.Neuraloop.Description.value: When a public objective is revealed, you may purge one of your relics to discard that objective and replace it with a random objective from any objective deck; that objective is a public objective, even if it is a secret objective.

Relics.Scepter of Emelpar.Description.value: When you would spend a token from your strategy pool, you may exhaust this card to spend a token from your reinforcements instead.

Relics.Shard of the Throne.Description.value: When you gain this card, gain 1 victory point. When you lose this card, lose 1 victory point.
When a player gains control of a legendary planet you control, or a planet you control in your home system, that player gains this card.

Relics.Starfall Array.Description.value: When 1 or more of your units roll dice for a unit ability, you may apply +1 to the result of each of those dice, and 1 of those units may roll 1 additional die.

Relics.Stellar Converter.Description.value: ACTION: Choose 1 non-home, non-legendary planet other than Mecatol Rex in a system that is adjacent to 1 or more of your units that have BOMBARDMENT; destroy all units on that planet and purge its attachments and its planet card. Then, place the destroyed planet token on that planet and purge this card.

Relics.The Codex.Description.value: ACTION: Purge this card to take up to 3 action cards of your choice from the action card discard pile.

Relics.The Crown of Emphidia.Description.value: After you perform a tactical action, you may exhaust this card to explore 1 planet you control.
At the end of the status phase, if you control the "Tomb of Emphidia", you may purge this card to gain 1 Victory Point.

Relics.The Crown of Thalnos.Description.value: During each combat round, this card's owner may reroll any number of their dice, applying +1 to the results; any units that reroll dice but do not produce at least 1 hit are destroyed.

Relics.The Obsidian.Description.value: When you gain this card, draw 1 secret objective. You can have 1 additional scored or unscored secret objective.

Relics.The Prophet's Tears.Description.value: When you research a technology, you may exhaust this card to ignore 1 prerequisite or draw 1 action card.

Relics.The Quantumcore.Description.value: When you gain this card, gain your breakthrough.
You have SYNERGY for all technology types.

Relics.The Silver Flame.Description.value: The Silver Flame may be exchanged as part of a transaction.

ACTION: Roll 1 die and purge this card; if the result is a 10, gain 1 victory point. Otherwise, purge your home system and all units in it; you cannot score public objectives. Put The Fracture into play if it is not already.

Relics.The Triad.Description.value: This card can be readied and spent as if it were a planet card. Its resource and influence values are equal to 3 plus the number of different types of relic fragments you own.

Relics.Twilight Mirror.Description.value: At the start of the agenda phase, you may purge this card to resolve 1 non-strategic action.

Sardakk N'orr.Abilities.Unrelenting.Desc.value: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

Sardakk N'orr.Breakthrough.N'orr Suprema.value: After you win a combat, either gain 1 command token or research a unit upgrade technology.

Sardakk N'orr.Leaders.G'hom Sek'kus.Desc.value: You can commit up to 1 ground force from each planet in the active system and each planet in adjacent systems that do not contain 1 of your command tokens.

Sardakk N'orr.Leaders.Sh'val, Harbinger..value: After you move ships into the active system:

You may skip directly to the "Commit Ground Forces" step. If you do, after you commit ground forces to land on planets, purge this card and return each of your ships in the active system to your reinforcements.

Sardakk N'orr.Leaders.T'ro.Description.value: At the end of a player's tactical action:
You may exhaust this card; if you do, that player may place 2 infantry from their reinforcements on a planet they control in the active system.

Sardakk N'orr.Promissories.Tekklar Legio.value: At the start of an invasion combat:
Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat. If your opponent is the N'orr player, apply -1 to the result of each of their unit's combat rolls during this combat.
Then, return this card to the N'orr player.

Sardakk N'orr.Techs.Exotrireme II.Descri.value: After a round of space combat, you may destroy this unit to destroy up to 2 ships in this system.
"Direct Hit" cards are no longer effective against this type of ship.

Sardakk N'orr.Techs.Valkyrie Particle We.value: After making combat rolls during a round of ground combat, if your opponent produced 1 or more hits, you produce 1 additional hit.

Sardakk N'orr.Units.C'Morran N'orr.Descr.value: Apply +1 to the result of each of your other ship's combat rolls in this system.

Sardakk N'orr.Units.Valkyrie Exoskeleton.value: After this unit uses its SUSTAIN DAMAGE ability during ground combat, it produces 1 hit against your opponent's ground forces on this planet.

Strategy Cards.Aeterna.Primary.value: Immediately score 1 public objective if you fulfill its requirements; otherwise, draw 1 paradigm.
Gain 1 victory point if you control Mecatol Rex; otherwise, draw 1 secret objective.

Strategy Cards.Aeterna.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to draw 1 secret objective or 1 paradigm.

Strategy Cards.Amicus.Primary.value: Choose any number of other players. Those players use the secondary ability of this strategy card without spending a command token.

Strategy Cards.Amicus.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to replenish your commodities.

Strategy Cards.Calamitas.Primary.value: Resolve the PRODUCTION abilities of your units in 1 system.

Strategy Cards.Calamitas.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool and 4 resources to either participate in the unit upgrade splice or use the PRODUCTION abilities of the units in your home system.

Strategy Cards.Civitas.Primary.value: Either place 1 structure on a planet you control or use the PRODUCTION ability of 1 of your space docks.
Place 1 structure on a planet you control.

Strategy Cards.Civitas.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 structure on a planet you control.

Strategy Cards.Construction.POK.Secondar.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool and place it in any system; you may place either 1 space dock or 1 PDS on a planet you control in that system.

Strategy Cards.Construction.Primary.value: Place 1 PDS or 1 Space Dock on a planet you control.
Place 1 PDS on a planet you control.

Strategy Cards.Construction.Secondary.value: Place 1 token from your strategy pool in any system; you may place either 1 space dock or 1 PDS on a planet you control in that system.

Strategy Cards.Construction.TE.Primary.value: Either place 1 structure on a planet you control, or use the PRODUCTION ability of 1 of your space docks.
Place 1 structure on a planet you control.

Strategy Cards.Construction.TE.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 structure on a planet you control.

Strategy Cards.Diplomacy.Codex I.Primary.value: Choose 1 system other than the Mecatol Rex system that contains a planet you control; each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in the chosen system. Then, ready up to 2 exhausted planets you control.

Strategy Cards.Diplomacy.Codex I.Seconda.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to ready up to 2 exhausted planets you control.

Strategy Cards.Diplomacy.Codex One.Prima.value: Choose 1 system other than the Mecatol Rex system that contains a planet you control; each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in the chosen system. Then, ready up to 2 exhausted planets you control.

Strategy Cards.Diplomacy.Primary.value: Choose 1 system other than the Mecatol Rex system that contains a planet you control; each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in the chosen system. Then, ready each exhausted planet you control in that system.

Strategy Cards.Diplomacy.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to ready up to 2 exhausted planets.

Strategy Cards.Imperial.Primary.value: Immediately score 1 public objective if you fulfill its requirements.
Gain 1 victory point if you control Mecatol Rex; otherwise, draw 1 secret objective.

Strategy Cards.Imperial.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to draw 1 secret objective.

Strategy Cards.Leadership.Primary.value: Spend any amount of influence to gain 1 command token for every 3 influence spent.

Strategy Cards.Leadership.Secondary.value: Spend any amount of influence to gain 1 command token for every 3 influence spent.

Strategy Cards.Lux.Primary.value: Spend any amount of influence to gain 1 command token for every 3 influence spent.

Strategy Cards.Lux.Secondary.value: Spend any amount of influence to gain 1 command token for every 3 influence spent.

Strategy Cards.Magus.Primary.value: Initiate an ability splice. You may spend 3 resources and 3 influence to add 1 additional ability to the pool; if you do, after each player has chosen, it passes back to you and you take an additional ability.

Strategy Cards.Magus.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool and 3 resources or 3 influence to participate in the ability splice.

Strategy Cards.Noctis.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to participate in the genome splice.

Strategy Cards.Politics.Primary.value: Choose a player other than the speaker. That player gains the speaker token.
Look at the top 2 cards of the agenda deck. Place each card on the top or bottom of the deck in any order.

Strategy Cards.Politics.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to draw 2 action cards.

Strategy Cards.Technology.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool and 4 resources to research 1 technology.

Strategy Cards.Trade.Primary.value: Choose any number of other players. Those players use the secondary ability of this strategy card without spending a command token.

Strategy Cards.Trade.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to replenish your commodities.

Strategy Cards.Tyrannus.Primary.value: Choose a player other than the speaker. That player gains the speaker token.
Choose a player other than the speaker or tyrant. That player gainst the benediction token.

Strategy Cards.Tyrannus.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to draw 2 action cards.

Strategy Cards.Warfare.Primary.value: Remove 1 of your command tokens from the game board; then, gain 1 command token.
Redistribute any number of the command tokens on your command sheet.

Strategy Cards.Warfare.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to use the PRODUCTION ability of 1 of your space docks in your home system.

Strategy Cards.Warfare.TE.Primary.value: Perform a tactical action in any system without placing a command token, even if the system already has your command token in it; that system still counts as being activated. You may redistribute your command tokens before and after this action.

Strategy Cards.Warfare.TE.Secondary.value: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to use the PRODUCTION abilities of units in your home system.

TF.Ability.Abundance.Text.value: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION, you may gain 1 trade good.

TF.Ability.Aerie Hololattice.Text.value: Other players cannot move ships through systems that contain your structures.
Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the PRODUCTION 1 ability as if it were a unit.

TF.Ability.Aetherstream.Text.value: After you or one of your neighbors activates a system that is adjacent to an anomaly:
You may apply +1 to the move value of all of that player's ships during this tactical action.

TF.Ability.Agency Supply Network.Text.value: Once per action, when you resolve a unit's PRODUCTION ability:
You may resolve another of your unit's PRODUCTION abilities in any system.

TF.Ability.Amalgamation.Text.value: Capture your opponent's non-structure units that are destroyed during combat.
When you produce a unit, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to produce that unit without spending resources.

TF.Ability.Ambush.Text.value: At the start of a space combat:

You may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of their ships.

TF.Ability.Armada.Text.value: The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool.

TF.Ability.Assimilate.Text.value: When you gain control of a planet:
Replace each structure on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

TF.Ability.Awaken.Text.value: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your infantry, you may replace 1 of those infantry with a PDS from your reinforcements.

TF.Ability.Bio-Synthetic Synergy.Text.value: Your action cards cannot be canceled by "Shatter" action cards.
Your other abilities cannot be taken, purged, or discarded by other players and cannot have singularity tokens placed on them.

TF.Ability.Bioplasmosis.Text.value: At the start of the status phase:
You may remove any number of ground forces from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.

TF.Ability.Chaos Mapping.Text.value: At the start of your turn during the action phase:
You may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units that has PRODUCTION.

TF.Ability.Courier Transport.Text.value: You may move your structures from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens onto planets you control in the active system.

TF.Ability.Crafty.Text.value: You can have any number of action cards in your hand. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.
During your turn of the action phase, players that have passed cannot play action cards.

TF.Ability.Crucible.Text.value: Your ships do not roll for gravity rifts; apply an additional +1 to the move values of your ships that would move out of or through a gravity rift instead.

TF.Ability.Devotion.Text.value: You may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships in that system.

TF.Ability.Dimensional Splicer.Text.value: At the start of a space combat in a system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of your ships:
You may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships.

TF.Ability.Dimensional Tear.Text.value: Systems that contain your space docks are also gravity rifts; your ships do not roll for these gravity rifts. Place a dimensional tear token beneath your space docks as a reminder.

TF.Ability.Distant Suns.Text.value: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs:
You may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.

TF.Ability.E-Res Siphons.Text.value: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:

TF.Ability.Entropic Harvest.Text.value: At the end of any player's combat:
Gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

TF.Ability.Fabrication.Text.value: ACTION: Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

TF.Ability.Fleet Logistics.Text.value: During each of your turns of the action phase, you may perform 2 actions instead of 1.

TF.Ability.Foresight.Text.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:
You may place 1 command token from your reinforcements in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.

TF.Ability.Future Path.Text.value: When you gain trade goods from choosing a previously unchosen strategy card or from the "Amicus" strategy card:

TF.Ability.Genetic Research.Text.value: At the start of the status phase:
Choose a technology color and gain trade goods equal to the number of abilities you own that have that technology color.

TF.Ability.Guild Ships.Text.value: You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
You can exchange action cards with other players as part of transactions.

TF.Ability.Harrow.Text.value: At the end of each round of ground combat:
Your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.

TF.Ability.Hegemonic Trade Policy.Text.value: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCITON:
You may swap the resource and influence values of 1 planet you control during this use of PRODUCTION.

TF.Ability.Indoctrination.Text.value: At the start of a ground combat:
You may spend 2 influence to replace 1 of your opponent's participating infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.

TF.Ability.Inheritance Systems.Text.value: Draw 1 additional action card and gain 1 additional command token.

TF.Ability.Instinct Training.Text.value: When another player plays an action card:
You may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to cancel that action card.

TF.Ability.Lazax Gate Folding.Text.value: Treat systems that contain legendary planets you do not control as if they contain both an alpha and beta wormhole.

TF.Ability.Liberate.Text.value: When you gain control of a planet:
Ready that planet if it contains a number of your infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 infantry on that planet.

TF.Ability.Magmus Reactor.Text.value: Your units can move into and through supernovas.
Each supernova that does not contain other players' units and each system that contains 1 or more of your war suns gains the PRODUCTION 5 ability as if it were one of your units.

TF.Ability.Mirror Computing.Text.value: Each trade good is worth 2 resources or influence instead of 1.

TF.Ability.Mitosis.Text.value: At the start of the status phase:
Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

TF.Ability.Munitions Reserves.Text.value: At the start of each round of space combat:
You may spend 2 trade goods; you may reroll any number of your dice during this combat round.

TF.Ability.Nanomachines.Text.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to place 1 PDS on a planet you control.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to repair all of your damaged units.
ACTION: Exhaust this card and discard 1 action card to draw 1 action card.

TF.Ability.Neural Parasite.Text.value: At the start of your turn:
Destroy 1 of another player's infantry in or adjacent to a system that contains your infantry.

TF.Ability.Neuroglaive.Text.value: After another player actvates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:
That player removes 1 token from their fleet pool and returns it to their reinforcements.

TF.Ability.Nomadic.Text.value: You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.
Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships.

TF.Ability.Non-Euclidean Shielding.Text.value: When 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE:

TF.Ability.Nullification Field.Text.value: When another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:
You may exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to immediately end that player's turn.

TF.Ability.Orbital Drop.Text.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

TF.Ability.Overwatch.Text.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 of your command tokens:
You may return that token to your reinforcements.

TF.Ability.Pacifist.Text.value: If your units on that planet are not already coexisting, you may choose for your units to coexist.

TF.Ability.Peace Accords.Text.value: After you spend a token from your strategy pool:
You may gain control of 1 planet that does not contain the custodians token or any units and is adjacent to a planet you control.

TF.Ability.Pillage.Text.value: After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction:
If they have 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of their trade goods or commodities.

TF.Ability.Planesplitter.Text.value: When you gain this card, put The Fracture into play.
Apply +1 to the MOVE value of each of your ships that start its movement in The Fracture.
Apply +2 to the result of each of your units' combat rolls in The Fracture.

TF.Ability.Proxima Targeting VI.Text.value: Cancel 1 hit produced by each BOMBARDMENT roll against your units.
At the start of a round of ground combat, you may resolve BOMBARDMENT 7 (x3) against your opponent's ground forces; if you do, resolve BOMBARDMENT 7 (x3) against your own ground forces.

TF.Ability.Puppet Council.Text.value: At the start of the strategy phase:
Replenish your commodities, then gain 1 trade good.

TF.Ability.Quantum Datahub Node.Text.value: At the end of the strategy phase:
You may spend 1 token from your strategy pool and give another player 3 of your trade goods. If you do, give 1 of your strategy cards to that player and take 1 of their strategy cards.

TF.Ability.Quantum Drive.Text.value: You can produce your flagship without spending resources.

TF.Ability.Quantum Entanglement.Text.value: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

TF.Ability.Radical Advancement.Text.value: At the start of the status phase:

You may choose to replace 1 of your abilities; if you do, reveal abilities from the deck until you reveal another ability with the same technology color and gain it; shuffle the replaced ability and the other revealed cards back into the deck.

TF.Ability.Raid Formation.Text.value: When 1 or more of your units uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE:
For each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has SUSTAIN DAMAGE to become damaged.

TF.Ability.Reclamation.Text.value: After you resolve an action during which you gained control of a legendary planet:
You may place 1 PDS and 1 space dock from your reinforcements on that planet.

TF.Ability.Scavenge.Text.value: After you gain control of a planet:

TF.Ability.Scheming.Text.value: When you draw 1 or more action cards:
Draw 1 additional action card. Then, choose and discard 1 action card from your hand.

TF.Ability.Singularity X.Text.value: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed:

You may place the "Singularity X" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

TF.Ability.Singularity Y.Text.value: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed:

You may place the "Singularity Y" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

TF.Ability.Singularity Z.Text.value: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed:

You may place the "Singularity Z" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

TF.Ability.Sled Factories.Text.value: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION:
Reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 2.

TF.Ability.Slipstream.Text.value: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in a system that contains a wormhole.

TF.Ability.Smothering Presence.Text.value: Other players' units in or adjacent to systems that contain your structures lose all of their unit abilities.

TF.Ability.Spatial Conduit Cylinder.Text.value: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your units:
That system is adjacent to all other systems that contain 1 or more of your units during this action.

TF.Ability.Spec Ops Training.Text.value: After 1 of your ground forces is destroyed:
Roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

TF.Ability.Stall Tactics.Text.value: ACTION: Discard 1 action card from your hand.

TF.Ability.Star Forge.Text.value: ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

TF.Ability.Stellar Genesis.Text.value: After you spend a token from your strategy pool:

TF.Ability.Stymie.Text.value: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units:
You may place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system.

TF.Ability.Subatomic Splicer.Text.value: When one of your ships is destroyed:
You may produce a ship of the same type at a space dock in your home system.

TF.Ability.Supercharge.Text.value: Choose 1 of your units and apply +2 to the results of its combat roll.

TF.Ability.Survival Instinct.Text.value: After a player actives a system that contains your ships:
You may move up to 2 of your ships into the active system from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens.

TF.Ability.Tactical Brilliance.Text.value: After you roll dice for a unit ability:
You may reroll any of those dice.

TF.Ability.Telepathic.Text.value: At the end of the strategy phase:
Place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.
This card cannot have a singularity token placed on it.

TF.Ability.Temporal Command Suite.Text.value: After any player's genome becomes exhausted:
You may spend 3 influence to ready that genome; if you ready another player's genome, you may perform a transaction with that player.

TF.Ability.Terraform.Text.value: Planets that contain your structures are treated as having all 3 planet traits (cultural, hazardous, and industrial)

TF.Ability.The Burning Eye.Text.value: You can treat planets in systems that contain your ships as if you contolled them for the purpose of scoring secret objectives.

TF.Ability.Unrelenting.Text.value: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

TF.Ability.Valkyrie Particle Weave.Text.value: After making combat rolls during a round of ground combat:
If your opponent produced 1 or more hits, you produce 1 additional hit.

TF.Ability.Valkyrie Vanguard.Text.value: You can commit up to 1 ground force from each planet in the active system and each planet in adjacent systems that do not contain 1 of your command tokens.

TF.Ability.Versatile.Text.value: When you gain command tokens during the status phase:

TF.Ability.Voidborn.Text.value: Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement.
You can allow other players to move their ships through systems that contain your ships.

TF.Ability.Yin Ascendant.Text.value: Draw 1 genome, ability, or unit upgrade.

TF.Ability.Zealous.Text.value: When 1 or more of your units roll dice for a unit ability:
You may choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.

TF.Edict.Arbitrate.Text.value: You may discard any of your spliced cards. For each card you discarded, draw 1 card of that type. Then, you may allow any other players to do the same.

TF.Edict.Arise.Text.value: Either place 1 infantry on each planet you control or place 1 fighter in each system that contains your ships.

TF.Edict.Artifice.Text.value: Draw 1 relic and 1 paradigm; for each point behind the player with the most victory points you are, you may draw an additional card from either deck. Choose one of each type to keep and shuffle the rest back into their respective decks.

TF.Edict.Bless.Text.value: Gain each of the following, then each other player chooses 1 of the following to gain:

TF.Edict.Censure.Text.value: Place any player's control token on this card. That player cannot perform transactions during this game round. Discard this card at the end of the status phase.

TF.Edict.Convene.Text.value: Reveal ability cards equal to the number of players. The speaker chooses 1 of them for you to gain. Then, you choose 1 ability for each other player to gain.

TF.Edict.Execute.Text.value: Choose up to 3 planets; destroy half of the infantry on each of those planets, rounded up.

TF.Edict.Foretell.Text.value: Look at up to 3 unrevealed public objectives.

TF.Edict.Legacy of Ixth.Text.value: 1-5: Destroy each unit in the Mecatol Rex system, then each player destroys 3 of their units in each system adjacent to Mecatol Rex.
6-9: Each player draws 1 spliced card from any deck.
10: Draw up to 2 spliced cards from any decks.

TF.Edict.Splice.Text.value: Initiate a splice of any type, including all players.

TF.Genome.Action Genome.Text.value: You may exhaust this card to allow any player to spend commodities as if they were trade goods.

TF.Genome.Altruistic Genome.Text.value: When a hit is produced against a unit:
You may exhaust this card to cancel that hit.

TF.Genome.Aristocratic Genome.Text.value: At the start of a space combat round:
You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ship in the active system; that ship rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.

TF.Genome.Breach Genome.Text.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose 1 player. That player may swap the position of 2 of their ships in any systems; they may transport units when they swap.

TF.Genome.Brutal Genome.Text.value: After a player activates a system:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to replace 1 of their infantry in the active system with 1 mech from their reinforcements.

TF.Genome.Captain's Genome.Text.value: After a player activates a system:
You may exhaust this card to increase the move value of 1 of that player's ships to match the move value of the ship on the game board that has the highest move value.

TF.Genome.Clever Genome.Text.value: This card has the text ability of each other player's genomes, even if those genomes are exhausted.

TF.Genome.Cosmic Genome.Text.value: After a player moves ships into a system that does not contain any planets:
You may exhaust this card; that player gains 1 command token.

TF.Genome.Courier Genome.Text.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to draw 2 action cards; give 1 of those cards to another player.

TF.Genome.Curious Genome.Text.value: At the end of a player's turn:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to explore 1 of their planets.

TF.Genome.Deployment Genome.Text.value: At the end of a player's turn:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to remove up to 2 of their ground forces from the game board and place them on planets they control in the active system.

TF.Genome.Diplomatic Genome.Text.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to ready any planet; if that planet is in a system that is adjacent to a planet you control, you may remove 1 infantry from that planet and return it to its reinforcements.

TF.Genome.Divine Genome.Text.value: When 1 or more of a player's units use PRODUCTION:
You may exhaust this card to reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 2.

TF.Genome.Enigmatic Genome.Text.value: After a player activates a non-home system that contains a wormhole:
You may exhaust this card; if you do, that system is adjacent to all other systems that contain a wormhole during this tactical action.

TF.Genome.Experimental Genome.Text.value: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to remove any number of their infantry from the game board. For each unit removed, reduce the resources spent by 1.

TF.Genome.Human Genome.Text.value: At the start of a ground combat round:
You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ground force in the active system; that ground force rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.

TF.Genome.Hyper Genome.Text.value: You may exhaust this card and choose another player; that player gives you 1 trade good, if able, then you each draw 1 action card.

TF.Genome.Investment Genome.Text.value: When you gain trade goods from the supply:
You may exhaust this card to place an equal number of trade goods on this card. When this card readies, gain the trade goods on this card.

TF.Genome.Limit Genome.Text.value: After any player's command token is placed in a system:
You may exhaust this card to return that token to that player's reinforcements.

TF.Genome.Mirror Genome.Text.value: You may exhaust this card; if you do, SPACE CANNON cannot be used against those ships; if they are not transporting units, they can also move through other players' ships.

TF.Genome.Molten Genome.Text.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may produce up to 2 units that each have a cost of 4 or less in a system that contains one of their war suns or their flagship.

TF.Genome.Pacific Genome.Text.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose any player's non-fighter ship; that player may replace that ship with one from their reinforcements that costs up to 2 more than the replaced ship.

TF.Genome.Ravenous Genome.Text.value: You may exhaust this card to convert their commodities to trade goods and capture 1 unit from their reinforcements that has a cost equal to or lower than their commodity value.

TF.Genome.Recursive Genome.Text.value: You may exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may discard 1 action card or spend 1 command token from their command sheet to gain 2 trade goods.

TF.Genome.Research Genome.Text.value: When a player initiates a splice:
You may exhaust this card to add 3 additional cards to that splice.

TF.Genome.Scornful Genome.Text.value: When a player produces ground forces in a system:
You may exhaust this card; that player may place those units on any planets they control in that system and any adjacent systems.

TF.Genome.Silver Genome.Text.value: You may exhaust this card to gain 2 commodities or replenish another player's commodities.

TF.Genome.Splitting Genome.Text.value: After a player's destroyer or cruiser is destroyed:
You may exhaust this card. If you do, that player may place up to 2 fighters from their reinforcements in that unit's system.

TF.Genome.Swarm Genome.Text.value: At the end of a player's tactical action:
You may exhaust this card; if you do, that player may place 2 infantry from their reinforcements on a planet they control in the active system.

TF.Genome.Temporal Genome.Text.value: After the "Roll Dice" step of combat:
You may exhaust this card. If you do, hits are not assigned to either players' units. Return to the start of this combat round's "Roll Dice" step.

TF.Genome.Valiant Genome.Text.value: When a player's unit is destroyed during combat:
You may exhaust this card to roll 1 die. If the result is equal to or greater than that unit's combat value, their opponent must choose and destroy 1 of their units.

TF.Paradigm.Artemis Ascendent.Text.value: At the start of a round of space combat in a system that contains a planet you control:
Place your flagship and any combination of up to a total of 2 cruisers or destroyers from your reinforcements in the active system.

TF.Paradigm.Awakening.Text.value: ACTION: Ready a planet you control and attach this card to it. Its resource and influence values are each increased by 3, and it gains the SPACE CANNONS 5 (X3) ability as if it were a unit.

TF.Paradigm.Blessing of the Yin.Text.value: ACTION: Commit up to 3 infantry from your reinforcements to any non-home planets and resolve ground combats on those planets; players cannot use SPACE CANNON against these units.

TF.Paradigm.Brillance of the Hylar.Text.value: ACTION: Draw 1 genome, 1 unit upgrade, and 1 ability.

TF.Paradigm.Brood Swarm.Text.value: After you move ships into the active system:

You may skip directly to the "Commit Ground Forces" step. If you do, after you commit ground forces to land on planets, purge this card and return each of your ships in the active system to your reinforcements

TF.Paradigm.Changing the Ways.Text.value: ACTION: Swap the positions of any two non-Fracture systems that contain wormholes or your units, other than the Creuss system, Ahk Creuxx system, or the wormhole nexus.

TF.Paradigm.Devour World.Text.value: ACTION: Choose a planet that has a technology specialty in a system that contains your units. Destroy any other player's units on that planet. Gain trade goods equal to that planet's combined resource and influence values and draw 1 ability. Then purge this card.

TF.Paradigm.Diaspora.Text.value: ACTION: Choose 1 system that does not contain other players' ships; you may move your flagship and any number of your dreadnoughts from other systems into the chosen system.

TF.Paradigm.Dimensional Reflection.Text.value: You may place any of those ships onto this card.
At the start of a combat, you may purge this card to place all ships from this card into the active system.

TF.Paradigm.Eternity's End.Text.value: ACTION: Search the ability, unit upgrade, or genome deck for any card and gain it.

TF.Paradigm.Event Horizon.Text.value: ACTION: Each other player rolls a die for each of their non-fighter ships that are in or adjacent to a system that contains a gravity rift; on a 1-5, return that unit to their reinforcements.

TF.Paradigm.Extortion.Text.value: ACTION: Each other player shows you 1 action card from their hand. For each player, you may either take that card or force that player to discard 3 random action cards from their hand.

TF.Paradigm.Flock Migration.Text.value: ACTION: Move any number of your ships from any systems to any number of other systems that contain 1 of your command tokens and no other players' ships.

TF.Paradigm.Forge Legend.Text.value: ACTION: Gain 1 relic and 2 command tokens.

TF.Paradigm.Gravitational Collapse.Text.value: After you move a war sun into a non-home system other than Mecatol Rex:

You may destroy all other players' units in that system and replace that system tile with the Muaat supernova tile. If you do, purge this card and each planet card that corresponds to the replaced system tile.

TF.Paradigm.Insurrection.Text.value: At the start of a space combat that you are participating in:
You may purge this card; if you do, for each other player's ship that is destroyed during this combat, place 1 ship of that type from your reinforcements in the active system.

TF.Paradigm.Intelligence Unshackled.Text.value: When one of your units is destroyed:

You may purge this card to designate that unit as the catalyst; roll 1 die for each other player's unit in the system. For each result equal to or greater than the catalyst's combat value, destroy that unit.

TF.Paradigm.Limit Break.Text.value: You may choose to no longer be passed; if you do, gain 2 command tokens, draw 1 action card, and purge this card.

TF.Paradigm.Opening the Eye.Text.value: ACTION: Place 1 frontier token in each system that does not contain any planets and does not already have a frontier token. Then, explore each frontier token that is in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

TF.Paradigm.Overgrowth.Text.value: ACTION: Produce any number of units in any number of systems that contain 1 or more of your ground forces.

TF.Paradigm.Poison of the Nefishh.Text.value: At the end of the status phase:
You may choose an ability owned by another player; they must either give you that ability or give you 2 other abilities. If you do, purge this card.

TF.Paradigm.Sanction of the Quieron.Text.value: ACTION: Resolve the PRODUCTION abilities of your units in your home system. You may reduce the cost of each of your units to 0 during this use of PRODUCTION. Then, purge this card.

TF.Paradigm.Sins of the Father.Text.value: ACTION: Perform the primary ability of any strategy card. Then, choose any number of other players. Those players may perform the secondary ability of that strategy card.

TF.Paradigm.The Laws Unwritten.Text.value: ACTION: Purge an ability owned by any player.

TF.Paradigm.The Lay of Lisis.Text.value: ACTION: Choose 1 system that is adjacent to 1 of your space docks. Destroy all other players' infantry and fighters in that system.

TF.Paradigm.The Winds of Change.Text.value: ACTION: Reveal cards from the action card deck until you have 3 action cards that have component actions. Draw those cards and shuffle the rest back into the action card deck.

TF.Paradigm.Time Warp.Text.value: ACTION: Place this card near the game board; your flagship and units it transports can move out of systems that contain your command tokens during this game round.
At the end of that game round, purge this card.

TF.Paradigm.Twilight Directive.Text.value: ACTION: Remove each of your command tokens from the game board and return them to your reinforcements.

TF.Paradigm.Voice of the Council.Text.value: ACTION: Reveal 3 edicts; choose 1 to resolve and shuffle the rest back into the edict deck.

TF.Paradigm.Void Transference.Text.value: ACTION: Place this card near the game board; the number of non-fighter ships you can have in systems is not limited by the number of command tokens in your fleet pool during this game round.
At the end of that game round, purge this card.

TF.Paradigm.Witching Hour.Text.value: ACTION: Choose a player other than the current speaker to gain the speaker token.
Choose a player other than the tyrant to gain the benediction token.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Ahk Syl Fier.Text.value: At the start of your turn, you may place or move a Creuss wormhole token into this system.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Ambassador.Text.value: After you commit units, if units transported by Ambassadors are the only units commited to a planet, you may place those units into coexistance instead.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Corsair.Text.value: If the active system contains another player's non-fighter ships, this unit can move through systems that contain other players' ships.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Dawncrusher.Text.value: This unit cannot be destroyed by "Spark" action cards.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Echo of Ascension.Text.value: Keep this card in your play area and adjust the printed values of your flagship by the indicated amounts.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Eidolon Landwaster.Text.value: Keep this card in your play area; your mechs roll 1 additional die during combat.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Eidolon Terminus.Text.value: Keep this card in your play area; the COMBAT value of your mechs is reduced by 1.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Exile.Text.value: This unit can move through systems that contain other player's ships.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Exotrireme.Text.value: This unit cannot be destroyed by "Spark" action cards.
After a round of space combat, you may destroy this unit to destroy up to 2 ships in this system.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Floating Factories.Text.value: This unit is placed in the space area instead of on a planet.
This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Guild Agents.Text.value: After you move this unit into a system that contains another player's units, you may look at that player's action cards and take 1 of them.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Hel-Titan.Text.value: This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported. You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON ability against ships that are adjacent to this unit's system.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Helios Entity.Text.value: This unit's PRODUCTION value is equal to 2 more than the resource value of this planet.
The resource value of this planet is increased by 2.
Up to 3 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Hybrid Crystal Fighter.T.value: This unit may move without being transported. Each fighter in excess of your ships' capacity counts as 1/2 of a ship against your fleet pool.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Justiciar Rall.Text.value: You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON ability against ships that are adjacent to this unit's system.
Hits produced by this unit must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Keeper Matrix.Text.value: Your may use this unit's SPACE CANNON ability against ships that are adjacent to this unit's system.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Linkship.Text.value: When this unit retreats, you may destroy 1 ship in the active system that is damaged or does not have SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Morphwing.Text.value: This unit may move without being transported. Fighters in excess of your ships' capacity count against your fleet pool. This ship can be committed during an invasion; either return it to the space area or replace it with 1 infantry at the end of combat.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Production Biomes.Text.value: Up to 3 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.
When this unit uses PRODUCTION, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to gain 4 trade goods and choose another player to gain 2 trade goods.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Prototype War Sun.Text.value: Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.
This unit and other units moving at the same time can move into and through supernovas.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Strike Wing Alpha.Text.value: When this unit uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, each result of 9 or 10 also destroys 1 of your opponent's infantry in the space area of the active system.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Super-Dreadnought.Text.value: This unit cannot be destroyed by "Spark" action cards.

TF.Unit Upgrade.The Dragon, Freed.Text.value: While you own this card, you can only have 1 war sun.
When this unit uses BOMBARDMENT, it uses it against each planet in its system and each adjacent system, even yours, ignoring PLANETARY SHIELD.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Triune.Text.value: This unit may move without being transported. Fighters in excess of your ships' capacity count against your fleet pool. You may remove 3 of your fighters from systems that contain or are adjacent to a player's units to cancel an action card played by that player.

TF.Unit Upgrade.University War Sun.Text.value: Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Valefar Prime.Text.value: Keep this card in your play area; the COST of your mechs is reduced by 1.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Vortexer.Text.value: Capture other players' infantry and fighters that are destroyed or removed in this unit's system or an adjacent system. At the start of your turn, you may spend captured infantry or fighters to place equivalent units from your reinforcements in this system.

TF.Unit Upgrade.Yin Clone.Text.value: After this unit is destroyed or removed, place the unit on this card. At the start of the status phase, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control.

Techs.4X4IC Helios V2.Description.value: This unit's PRODUCTION value is equal to 4 more than the resource value of this planet.
The resource value of this planet is increased by 2.
Up to 3 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.

Techs.AI Development Algorithm.Descripti.value: When you research a unit upgrade technology, you may exhaust this card to ignore any 1 prerequisite.
When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION, you may exhaust this card to reduce the combined cost of the produced units by the number of unit upgrade technologies that you own.

Techs.Antimass Deflectors.Description.value: Your ships can move into and through asteroid fields.
When other players' units use SPACE CANNON against your units, apply -1 to the result of each die roll.

Techs.Assault Cannon.Description.value: At the start of a space combat in a system that contains 3 or more of your non-fighter ships, your opponent must destroy 1 of their non-fighter ships.

Techs.Bio-Stims.Description.value: You may exhaust this card at the end of your turn to ready 1 of your planets that has a technology specialty or 1 of your other technologies.

Techs.Dark Energy Tap.Description.value: After you perform a tactical action in a system that contains a frontier token, if you have 1 or more ships in that system, explore that token.
Your ships can retreat into adjacent systems that do not contain other players' units, even if you do not have units or control planets in that system.

Techs.Daxcive Animators.Description.value: After you win a ground combat, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.

Techs.Dreadnought II.Description.value: "Direct Hit" cards are no longer effective against this type of ship.

Techs.Duranium Armor.Description.value: During each combat round, after you assign hits to your units, repair 1 of your damaged units that did not use SUSTAIN DAMAGE during this combat round.

Techs.Fighter II.Description.value: This unit may move without being transported. Fighters in excess of your ships' capacity count against your fleet pool.

Techs.Fleet Logistics.Description.value: During each of your turns of the action phase, you may perform 2 actions instead of 1.

Techs.Graviton Laser System.Description.value: You may exhaust this card before 1 or more of your units uses SPACE CANNON; hits produced by those units must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.

Techs.Gravity Drive.Description.value: After you activate a system, apply +1 to the move value of 1 of your ships during this tactical action.

Techs.Hyper Metabolism.Description.value: During the status phase, gain 3 command tokens instead of 2.

Techs.Infantry II.Description.value: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 6 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Techs.Integrated Economy.Description.value: After you gain control of a planet, you may produce any number of units on that planet that have a combined cost equal to or less than that planet's resource value.

Techs.Light/Wave Deflector.Description.value: Your ships can move through systems that contain other players' ships.

Techs.Magen Defense Grid.Codex Four.Desc.value: When any player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your structures, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements with each of those structures.
At the start of ground combat on a planet that contains 1 or more of your structures, produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ground forces.

Techs.Magen Defense Grid.Description.value: You may exhaust this card at the start of a round of ground combat on a planet that contains 1 or more of your units that have PLANETARY SHIELD; your opponent cannot make combat rolls this combat round.

Techs.Magen Defense Grid.Omega.Descripti.value: At the start of ground combat on a planet that contains 1 or more of your structures, you may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ground forces.

Techs.Neural Motivator.Description.value: During the status phase, draw 2 action cards instead of 1.

Techs.PDS II.Description.value: You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON against ships that are adjacent to this unit's system.

Techs.Plasma Scoring.Description.value: When 1 or more of your units use BOMBARDMENT or SPACE CANNON, 1 of those units may roll 1 additional die.

Techs.Predictive Intelligence.Descriptio.value: At the end of your turn, you may exhaust this card to redistribute your command tokens.
When you cast votes during the agenda phase, you may cast 3 additional votes; if you do, and the outcome you voted for is not resolved, exhaust this card.

Techs.Psychoarchaeology.Description.value: You can use technology specialties on planets you control without exhausting them, even if those planets are exhausted.
During the Action Phase, you can exhaust planets you control that have technology specialties to gain 1 trade good.

Techs.Sarween Tools.Description.value: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION, reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.

Techs.Scanlink Drone Network.Description.value: When you activate a system, you may explore 1 planet in that system which contains 1 or more of your units.

Techs.Self Assembly Routines.Description.value: After 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION, you may exhaust this card to place 1 mech from your reinforcements on a planet you control in that system.
After 1 of your mechs is destroyed, gain 1 trade good.

Techs.Sling Relay.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card to produce 1 ship in any system that contains 1 of your space docks.

Techs.Space Dock II.Description.value: This unit's PRODUCTION value is equal to 4 more than the resource value of this planet.
Up to 3 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.

Techs.Transit Diodes.Description.value: You may exhaust this card at the start of your turn during the action phase; remove up to 4 of your ground forces from the game board and place them on 1 or more planets you control.

Techs.War Sun.Description.value: Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

Techs.X-89 Bacterial Weapon.Codex Four.D.value: Double the hits produced by your units' BOMBARDMENT and ground combat rolls.
Exhaust each planet you use BOMBARDMENT against.

Techs.X-89 Bacterial Weapon.Description.value: ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose 1 planet in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships that have BOMBARDMENT; destroy all infantry on that planet.

Techs.X-89 Bacterial Weapon.Omega.Descri.value: After 1 or more of your units use BOMBARDMENT against a planet, if at least 1 of your opponent's infantry was destroyed, you may destroy all of your opponent's infantry on that planet.

The Ruby Monarch.Units.The Scarlet Knife.value: DEPLOY: At the start of your turn, you may discard 1 of your abilities or genomes to place this unit from your reinforcements into a system that contains your ships.

The Ruby Monarch.Units.The Sharpened Edg.value: DEPLOY: When your flagship is placed, you may place 1 mech into your flagship's space area.

The Saint of Swords.Units.Colada.Descrip.value: While this unit is being transported, choose 1 unit in its system that has a capacity value to roll 1 additional die on its combat rolls.

The Saint of Swords.Units.Tizona.Descrip.value: Apply +1 to the MOVE value of this ship if it would transport 4 units.

Titans of Ul.Abilities.Awaken.Descriptio.value: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your sleeper tokens, you may replace each of those tokens with 1 PDS from your reinforcements.

Titans of Ul.Abilities.Coalescence.Descr.value: If your flagship or your AWAKEN faction ability places your units into the same space area or onto the same planet as another player's units, your units must participate in combat during "Space Combat" or "Ground Combat" steps.

Titans of Ul.Abilities.Terragenesis.Desc.value: After you explore a planet that does not have a sleeper token, you may place or move 1 sleeper token onto that planet.

Titans of Ul.Breakthrough.Slumberstate C.value: When COALESCENCE results in a ground combat, if you commit no other units, you may choose for your units to coexist instead. During the status phase, for each player you are coexisting with, you and that player each draw 1 additional action card.
Other players may allow you to place a sleeper token on a planet they control.

Titans of Ul.Leaders.Tellurian.Descripti.value: When a hit is produced against a unit:
You may exhaust this card to cancel that hit.

Titans of Ul.Leaders.Tungstantus.Descrip.value: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION:

Titans of Ul.Leaders.Tungstantus.Unlock.value: Have 5 structures on the game board.

Titans of Ul.Leaders.Ul the Progenitor.D.value: ACTION: Ready Elysium and attach this card to it. Its resource and influence values are each increased by 3, and it gains the SPACE CANNON 5 (x3) ability as if it were a unit

Titans of Ul.Promissories.Terraform.Desc.value: ACTION: Attach this card to a non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex.
Its resource and influence values are each increased by 1 and it is treated as having all 3 planet traits (Cultural, Hazardous, and Industrial).

Titans of Ul.Techs.Hel Titan II.Descript.value: This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported. You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON against ships that are adjacent to this unit's system.
